subject: Add section for deliverables with no type
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-05 13:53:17.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/sphinxext.py'], 'message': 'Add section for deliverables with no type

Deliverables which do not have any type were assumed to be
type:service deliverables and were listed with services,
resulting in a crowded and confusing output.

This patch makes sure they are listed in their own section.
It is still wrong for some of them (which should really have the
type:service tag), but less wrong than considering them all as
services.

Change-Id: I828b0fb245443cf5e3fb50c222da3f70c65a014b
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add section for deliverables with no type

Deliverables which do not have any type were assumed to be
type:service deliverables and were listed with services,
resulting in a crowded and confusing output.

This patch makes sure they are listed in their own section.
It is still wrong for some of them (which should really have the
type:service tag), but less wrong than considering them all as
services.

Change-Id: I828b0fb245443cf5e3fb50c222da3f70c65a014b

commit_message:
Do not throw an error on validation when tunneling is disabled

When neutron tunneling is disabled, allow the passing of neutron network type
without the need for neutron tunnel types.

Change-Id: Ib09ef36507ffbe0589c57d1a23ee6da38ffa0e5a
Closes-Bug: #1507556

commit_message:
Log end of router updates for delete branch

The execution branch for delete calls continue directly
without logging the end of the router update.  This leads
to confusion about when the last router update finishes if
it is a delete.

Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
Closes-bug: #1511004
(cherry picked from commit 70b3d383ac2a0d7d339c551065b9b378a4b9b914)

Change-Id: I543a05d86785407e56613a43ae4afdca9f1b30e1

commit_message:
Allow empty directories for tempest init

tempest init directory parameter is optional. If not
given it uses the cwd as default. Unfortunately this
leads to an error since the existing of the directory
is checked and an error is raised.

Change-Id: I8c6a66df458ae08b29cd921dfa65ef68c76c7a7c
Closes-Bug: #1512994

commit_message:
Extract run aggregation into a separated class

Previously the run aggregation was happening on a long method that was
hard to follow. This commit extracts this logic into its own class as
well includes unit tests around it.

Change-Id: Ib580694c88e8fe032f03d2f2b694ea04f720ba36

commit_message:
Use common identity parameters fro keystone client

The common identity params need to be requested from keystone
client instead of storing them in glance client.

Change-Id: If1260fb1e01b1fff798e9ce170e58ac62521d97d

revisions:

Keystone will not return a description attribute if no description

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Normalize domain data

Keystone will not return a description attribute if no description
was given when creating a domain. So let's normalize the data so
all the things are there that we may expect.

Change-Id: I0fd14d512554853d5a5a052e0517f47a509a35b2

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-04 19:53:33.000000000', 'files': ['shade/_utils.py'], 'message': "Normalization methods should return Munch

For the 1.0 release, we settled on returning Munch objects
rather than plain dicts. However, we didn't arrange for that
in the place where we normalize the returned data.

Change-Id: I9eca96635ddfa012d6c5cff64162de1379f355ee
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Normalization methods should return Munch

For the 1.0 release, we settled on returning Munch objects
rather than plain dicts. However, we didn't arrange for that
in the place where we normalize the returned data.

Change-Id: I9eca96635ddfa012d6c5cff64162de1379f355ee

subject: Fix keystone domain searching
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-04 17:52:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix keystone domain searching

Domain searches is a bit different in that it pushes down the
filtering to the keystone client. This is fine, except that it
didn't work as the filters were not actually passed.

This change passes the filters, and changes the search_domains()
API to accept a 'filters' parameter to be consistent with our other
search methods. It previously accepted only keyword parameters rather
than just a filter dict. It keeps backward compatibility by also
accepting keyword parameters (but notes that is deprecated).

Change-Id: I61c8591493c5d10de38a6541a9859be2950d60a6

", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-11-04 18:52:22.000000000', 'files': ['shade/operatorcloud.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_domain.py', 'shade/_tasks.py'], 'message': "Fix keystone domain searching

Domain searches is a bit different in that it pushes down the
filtering to the keystone client. This is fine, except that it
didn't work as the filters were not actually passed.

This change passes the filters, and changes the search_domains()
API to accept a 'filters' parameter to be consistent with our other

Change-Id: I61c8591493c5d10de38a6541a9859be2950d60a6
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Fix keystone domain searching

Domain searches is a bit different in that it pushes down the
filtering to the keystone client. This is fine, except that it
didn't work as the filters were not actually passed.

This change passes the filters, and changes the search_domains()
API to accept a 'filters' parameter to be consistent with our other
search methods. It previously accepted only keyword parameters rather
than just a filter dict.

Change-Id: I61c8591493c5d10de38a6541a9859be2950d60a6

commit_message:
Don't warn on configured insecure certs

If we have to connect to bogus certs and we know this and we've
configured 'verfiy=False' meaning that we've explicitly indicated
that we want to turn off cert verification, then spamming our logs
with warnings that the certs are invalid is a bit lame. We know. We're
not happy about it - but at least one of our providers has bad certs. We
wish we had the power to change it, but we don't. We already feel bad.
STOP YELLING AT US.

Change-Id: I08d816bcc1685fc9ed3bfcf2e3e8300859059903

commit_message:
Multiple floating ranges support

* Remove multiple floating ranges checking from validation layer.
* Rename '_generate_external_network' to 'generate_external_network'.
* Add custom 'generate_external_network' for 'NeutronNetworkDeploymentSerializer80'.
* Change 'NetworkCheck.neutron_check_network_address_spaces_intersection'
  functionality. Now it checks all the floating ranges belong to public network.
* Remove irrelevant unit tests.
* Add unit tests for 'NeutronNetworkDeploymentSerializer80.generate_external_network'.

Change-Id: Ib277506db3c96890bc3ce2b4f312edd10841a95b
Partial-bug: #1490578

commit_message:
remove wheel cache code

Thanks to lifeless, pip now implicitly has a wheel cache so that it
builds a wheel before every install, and uses that cache. All our
clever attempts at manually doing wheelhouse things is actually
bypassing the existing cache and making things take longer.

We should remove all of this code and just let pip do this thing,
which is does very well, and get out of the way.

Change-Id: Ia140dc34638d893b92f66d1ba20efd9522c5923b
(cherry picked from commit 9013bb0c24623ce8d064b561d4fd331e370762e1)

commit_message:
remove wheel cache code

Thanks to lifeless, pip now implicitly has a wheel cache so that it
builds a wheel before every install, and uses that cache. All our
clever attempts at manually doing wheelhouse things is actually
bypassing the existing cache and making things take longer.

We should remove all of this code and just let pip do this thing,
which is does very well, and get out of the way.

Change-Id: Ia140dc34638d893b92f66d1ba20efd9522c5923b

commit_message:
Deprecated: timeutils.strtime & timeutils.isotime

Both oslo_utils.timeutils.strtime & oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime are
deprecated. Start replacing these deprecated calls with the recommended
alternatives:

  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.utils/api/timeutils.html

There are currently 90 deprecation warnings in the unit test logs for
these two functions. This patch removes about 60 of them.

Partial-Bug: #1479056
Change-Id: I8ab3e8f8751ffa6dc13cae16cd3fae6c242de135
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephen.finucane@intel.com>

commit_message:
Alembic update/cleanup

This change updates and cleans up our alembic migration code:
- we now use an alembic migration entry point, instead of shipping
  our own db management tool
- use expand/contract alembic branches
- downgrade is not supported anymore, and we had none, drop it

To allow testing the migration scripts, Neutron is added
as a dependency for tests (in way that avoids cloning the neutron repo
for each test run)

Change-Id: Ib122895e0a5b07eb1e7b1ec04233c49e95389476

commit_message:
Drop nova_admin_tenant_id_setter

Neutron now has two options nova_admin_tenant_id and nova_admin_tenant_name.
One can just simply specify name of the nova admin tenant instead of probing
the api to get tenant id.

Change-Id: I21dc10396e92906eab4651c318aa2ee62a8e03c7
(cherry picked from commit 919a3a932eccff507a8f974512cb8118ec6609e9)

commit_message:
Libvirt hardware policy from libosinfo

When launching an instance Nova needs to make decisions about how to
configure the virtual hardware. Currently these decisions are often
hardcoded, or driven by nova.conf settings, and sometimes by glance
image properties. The goal of this feature is to allow the user to
specify the guest OS type and then drive decisions from this fact,
using the libosinfo database.

Change-Id: I371ce444afc11904adc6816da1fd3bab25c55d60
Co-Authored-By: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
Blueprint: libvirt-hardware-policy-from-libosinfo
Previously-Approved: Liberty

commit_message:
tripleo.sh initial support for stable branches

Adds STABLE_RELEASE variable, which can be set, e.g to "liberty"
such that we configure the repos to use the centos7-liberty current
repos instead of trunk.

This automates the steps documented in:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238600/

Change-Id: I34ea635382114bf4f075f3d8df1188c3beae8727

subject: Alembic update/cleanup
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-05 13:35:10.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bagpipe_l2/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/HEADS'], 'message': 'Alembic update/cleanup

This change updates and cleans up our alembic migration code:
- we now use an alembic migration entry point, instead of shipping
  our own db management tool
- use expand/contract alembic branches
- downgrade is not supported anymore, and we had none, drop it

To allow testing the migration scripts, Neutron is added
as a dependency for tests (in way that avoids cloning the neutron repo
for each test run)

Change-Id: Ie8c889b81e9cc1e1606d69282767abc6fc8e6f1c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Alembic update/cleanup

This change updates and cleans up our alembic migration code:
- we now use an alembic migration entry point, instead of shipping
  our own db management tool
- use expand/contract alembic branches
- downgrade is not supported anymore, and we had none, drop it

To allow testing the migration scripts, Neutron is added
as a dependency for tests (in way that avoids cloning the neutron repo
for each test run)

Change-Id: Ie8c889b81e9cc1e1606d69282767abc6fc8e6f1c

subject: Database connection switching for cells
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-22 04:38:12.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/cells-db-connection-switching.rst'], 'message': 'Database connection switching for cells

In order for Nova API to perform queries on cell databases, the database
connection information for the target cell must be used. Nova API must
pass the cell database connection information to the DB API layer.

Related to blueprint cells-db-connection-switching

Previously-approved: Liberty

Change-Id: I6d6031446098a50ebca9eac6b5e27440e92c2a5a
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Database connection switching for cells

In order for Nova API to perform queries on cell databases, the database
connection information for the target cell must be used. Nova API must
pass the cell database connection information to the DB API layer.

Related to blueprint cells-db-connection-switching

Previously-approved: Liberty

Change-Id: I6d6031446098a50ebca9eac6b5e27440e92c2a5a

commit_message:
Alembic update/cleanup

This change updates and cleans up our alembic migration code:
- we now use an alembic migration entry point, instead of shipping
  our own db management tool
- use expand/contract alembic branches
- downgrade is not supported anymore, and we had none, drop it

To allow testing the migration scripts, Neutron is added
as a dependency for tests (in way that avoids cloning the neutron repo
for each test run)

Change-Id: Id07f9c9955392ea6eb059181d71a8cb58d2fd035

which results in the keystone container failing to restart. This is

commit_message:
Clean up keystone httpd pid files for RPM distros

In some cases we're seeing httpd not cleaning up properly after itself,
which results in the keystone container failing to restart. This is
confirmed to happen on rpm based distros, but have not had any reports
on Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I58b006189e700f1c851601b4f64dd0fae931103c
Closes-Bug: #1489676
Co-Authored-By: Tim Potter <tpot@hpe.com>

subject: Fix BUILD_PACKAGES flag
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-28 11:06:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix BUILD_PACKAGES flag

Build iso with BUILD_PACKAGES=0:

* late packages (fuel-bootstrap-image, fuel-target-centos-images,
  fuel-docker-images) should be always build in spite of
  BUILD_PACKAGES flag, since they are depend on the first level
  artifacts (packages);
* add packages to requirements, that we build during iso build

* fuel package should be added only after putting dependencies
  (fuel-bootstrap-image, fuel-target-centos-images, fuel-docker-images)
  to upstream mirror

* update requirements-*.txt files with adding all fuel packages

* Make sure the release version of bootstrap, centos-image and
   docker packages is increasing.
    We need to be sure that packages (in packages-late target):
     - fuel-bootstrap-image
     - fuel-target-centos-images
     - fuel-docker-images
    will increase their release numbers by 1 continuously
    in order to be able to ship them in updates repositories.

Change-Id: Iff839e8e6c3db0d7f7c1b3a28fd4f823d780ea7d
Closes-bug: #1460480

commit_message:
Fix BUILD_PACKAGES flag

Build iso with BUILD_PACKAGES=0:

* Late packages:
  - fuel-bootstrap-image,
  - fuel-target-centos-images,
  - fuel-docker-images,
  should be always build in spite of  BUILD_PACKAGES flag,
  since they are depend on the first level artifacts (packages)
  and are not in the mirrors yet;

* fuel matapackage can be added only after putting all
  dependencies to upstream mirror

* Update requirements-*.txt files with adding all fuel packages

* Make sure the release version of bootstrap, centos-image and
  docker packages is increasing in case of flag PATCHING_CI=1.
  We need to be sure that packages (in packages-late target):
     - fuel-bootstrap-image
     - fuel-target-centos-images
     - fuel-docker-images
    will increase their release numbers by 1 continuously
    in order to be able to ship them in updates repositories.

Change-Id: Iff839e8e6c3db0d7f7c1b3a28fd4f823d780ea7d
Closes-bug: #1460480

commit_message:
Catch use_ovs variable from Nailgun or calculate it for Neutron

in globals.pp

This allows to override this variable from plugin to prevent
from installing Openvswitch packet and starting corresponding services.
This functionality is needed for OVS-incompatible plugins, like Contrail.

Change-Id: I4457225e1fd7cac4b7ccc75ae94d5c5256027b87
Closes-bug: #1511809

commit_message:
Restrucutre gate scripts

So we can respect DRY and share as much code as possible I have broken
out the common code between the aio and multinode gate scripts.

Additionally, this lays the ground work for removing our policy on
root-everywhere by using sudo. Once we get the non-root stuff worked
out we can gate as non-root user.

Change-Id: I781c597ab10f2296b95f51ae27e0fa617ffe0a66
Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-21 20:17:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Get rid of contextlib.nested() for py3

contextlib.nested() is deprecated in Python 3, and it spews copious
warnings to make sure you know this.

Since 2.7, we can use multiple context managers in a 'with' statement,
like so:

    with thing1() as t1, thing2() as t2:
        do_stuff()

Now, if we had some code that needed to nest an arbitrary number of
context managers, there's stuff we could do with contextlib.ExitStack
and such... but we don't. We only use contextlib.nested() in tests to
set up bunches of mocks without crazy-deep indentation, and all that
stuff fits perfectly into multiple-context-manager 'with' statements.

Change-Id: Id472958b007948f05dbd4c7fb8cf3ffab58e2681
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-21 21:00:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Get rid of contextlib.nested() for py3

and such... but we don't. We only use contextlib.nested() in tests to
set up bunches of mocks without crazy-deep indentation, and all that
stuff fits perfectly into multiple-context-manager 'with' statements.

Change-Id: Id472958b007948f05dbd4c7fb8cf3ffab58e2681
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-10-23 18:45:52.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/account/test_reaper.py', 'test/unit/cli/test_recon.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_dlo.py', 'test/unit/common/test_wsgi.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_reconstructor.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempauth.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py', 'test/unit/container/test_sync.py', 'test/unit/container/test_reconciler.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync_receiver.py'], 'message': "Get rid of contextlib.nested() for py3

contextlib.nested() is missing completely in Python 3.

    with thing1() as t1, thing2() as t2:

Change-Id: Id472958b007948f05dbd4c7fb8cf3ffab58e2681
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Get rid of contextlib.nested() for py3

contextlib.nested() is missing completely in Python 3.

Since 2.7, we can use multiple context managers in a 'with' statement,
like so:

    with thing1() as t1, thing2() as t2:
        do_stuff()

Now, if we had some code that needed to nest an arbitrary number of
context managers, there's stuff we could do with contextlib.ExitStack
and such... but we don't. We only use contextlib.nested() in tests to
set up bunches of mocks without crazy-deep indentation, and all that
stuff fits perfectly into multiple-context-manager 'with' statements.

Change-Id: Id472958b007948f05dbd4c7fb8cf3ffab58e2681

commit_message:
Get user role without project id is not implemented

The router for getting user's role without project id is defined
for V2 API but not implemented so far, this change will make it
explicitly show that this http request is not implemented.

Co-Authored-By: Dave Chen <wei.d.chen@intel.com>
Closes-Bug: #1507920

Change-Id: Iae710915a912558057b942d3ca62ab380ce26003

commit_message:
Move table sorting functionality into dedicated directive.

This adds a new set of directives for table sorting functionality,
intended to greatly reduce the code needed to add the feature.
Sorting can now be added to any table by applying the new
`table-sort` directive, passing in a dataset, and mapping sort
fields to columns. Table output should instead use `table-ref`
to access a sorted array, but is otherwise fully compatible with
existing filter functionality.

Existing tables in project and tests views have also been updated
to make use of this new directive.

Change-Id: Ie3fd082008b21087d135363e302cc62703a1284a

commit_message:
Validate arguments for command rally verify compare

Running 'rally verify compare' command, if uuid is empty, it will
gives a unfriendly message.

This patch validate uuid agrument, and raise a friendly message
when meets an exception.

Closes-Bug: #1512707
Change-Id: I746ce5b436d5bc8ae54af64ffe8026a33a10ee1f

commit_message:
Add network_roles attribute to deployment tasks

network_roles attribute contains list of network roles needed for
deployment task.
Only needed network roles should be serialized by Nailgun.

Change-Id: Ie66ad7e6b06e53388b57abd2827887fce1781159
Implements: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic (partially)

commit_message:
Serialize net roles depends on deployment tasks

This changes adds:
 * class AllocateVIPs80Mixin
 * method to get enabled node roles in cluster
 * method to get enabled network roles in cluster

VIPs and network roles should serialize depends on enabled
deployment tasks

Implements: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic (partially)

Change-Id: I49879ba2bc87b9ebc0dd20742a8ff1db314692b9

commit_message:
Refactor upgrade_controlplane parts

* move network related methods from `upgrade_controlplane` to `env`
  module
* collect yaml files from nodes if bup info is not present
* extract `delete_overlay_networks` action to separate function

Change-Id: Ife7cb8a262cb85829f5e9cb3399efa5aff05143e

commit_message:
Use sum of volumes and snapshots for cinder usage

The cinder quota on gigabytes is the sum of both volumes and snapshots,
therefore in the horizon view we should be representing usage as the
combination of volumes and snapshots, otherwise users will be confused
when getting quota errors on volume or snapshot creation.

Closes-Bug: 1513179
Change-Id: Id23e0dd3a3f810e75f9013cecbf8a826c97e34c6

commit_message:
Alembic update/cleanup

This change updates and cleans up our alembic migration code:
- we now use an alembic migration entry point, instead of shipping
  our own db management tool
- use expand/contract alembic branches
- downgrade is not supported anymore, and we had none, drop it

To allow testing the migration scripts, Neutron is added
as a dependency for tests (in way that avoids cloning the neutron repo
for each test run)

Change-Id: Ib122895e0a5b07eb1e7b1ec04233c49e95389476

commit_message:
Remove dashes from short tar params

Using dashes with tar's short parameters creates a bunch of extra logging
output and warnings.  This should greatly reduce logging output.

Change-Id: Icf9392c749e3f9731e5bc182a242a2bc11e440a9
(cherry picked from commit d6930f1b04ce664af009263c6b9e80fc01102908)

commit_message:
Missing Open iSCSI daemon on compute hosts to use Cinder LUNs

Compute hosts need open-iscsi/iscsid container to attach to
remote luns if one boots from iscsi volume or attach it later
This commit only deals with client side iscsi.

Change-Id: I9ed18183d577e7e7764932515d9ba953127a5074
Closes-Bug: #1511699

Improved the error message.

While creating policy '>' operator is used,
due to which in py34 exception is occurred when
variable is provided from input parameter.

Exception was
TypeError: unorderable types: str() > int()

TODO: Add more unit test to catch such scenarios.

commit_message:
Comparision opeartor has been changed.

While creating policy '>' operator is used,
due to which in py34 exception is occurred when
variable is provided from input parameter.

Exception was
TypeError: unorderable types: str() > int()

TODO: Add more unit test to catch such scenarios.

Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-py3
Change-Id: I2c652812ae4a04cd7610f2a6684da76c582a4e32

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-11 20:49:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "(WIP) Dynamic dnsmasq config for admin network ranges

WORK IN PROGRESS

In order to successfully PXE/boot nodes from new racks we need to update
cobbler's dnsmasq configuration on changes in admin networks of any
nodegroup in any Fuel environment. Such changes should survive cobbler
container restarts and rebuilds.

In order to do so we need to execute the following on every change in
admin netwoks configuration of any nodegroup we have in Fuel:
- dump list of admin networks into /etc/hiera/networks.yaml file
  in mcollective container
- run 'puppet apply nailgin/examples/dhcp-ranges.pp' inside mcollective
  container to update config files in shared /etc/dnsmasq.d/ dir
- run 'cobbler sync' inside cobbler container to reload dnsmasq

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: I9d7428c9fc21c705a1aee7fbca8003829a81e1d0

commit_message:
Dynamic dnsmasq config for admin network ranges

In order to successfully PXE/boot nodes from new racks we need to update
cobbler's dnsmasq configuration on changes in admin networks of any
nodegroup in any Fuel environment. Such changes should survive cobbler
container restarts and rebuilds.

In order to do so we need to execute the following on every change in
admin netwoks configuration of any nodegroup we have in Fuel:
- dump list of admin networks into /etc/hiera/networks.yaml file
  in mcollective container
- run 'puppet apply nailgin/examples/dhcp-ranges.pp' inside mcollective
  container to update config files in shared /etc/dnsmasq.d/ dir
- run 'cobbler sync' inside cobbler container to reload dnsmasq

Co-Authored-By: Aleksandr Didenko <adidenko@mirantis.com>

Blueprint: dynamic-dnsmasq
Partial-bug: #1495593
Change-Id: I9d7428c9fc21c705a1aee7fbca8003829a81e1d0

commit_message:
Fix dependency for Ceilometer agent when using MySQL

In HA, when using MySQL as a backend for Ceilometer, the dependencies
set for the Ceilometer central agent depended always on MongoDB; Which
should only be the case if MongoDB is set as a backend.

Change-Id: I6fecfe0564b13e9352313c5a3492505b44d12eaa

commit_message:
Add AST checker for missing @ddt.ddt decorators

If a test case class has functions decorated with a ddt decorator, but
is not itself decorated with @ddt.ddt, then tests don't run
properly. This adds an AST checker to ensure that a class that
contains functions decorated with a ddt decorator is properly
decorated. It also includes unit tests for the checker itself.

Change-Id: If7186d1f8b9a1967e7af55d86cd568e323aeccf7

commit_message:
Add cleanup to cliff-based cli framework

Also disable ability to run script in stand-alone mode so
users will use 'tempest cleanup' instead.

Change-Id: I2119acd402b0985d4a81c85501ce7265f782d37b
Implements: blueprint tempest-cli-improvements

commit_message:
Add tox.ini with pep8 tests to fix CI

* Add tox.ini with pep8 tests so 'gate-fuel-web-pep8' is able to
  actually run
* Fix existing pep8 warnings

Related-Bug: #1511787

commit_message:
Remove ineffective assignment in subcommand

No need to assign return value to $rc in subcommand,
value in subcommand can not pass to parent process, plus,
it is never used.

Change-Id: I5f478813c7472d3709e09ff88f2165d5f1cd9097
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Remove unused setup_fedora.sh

The Fedora code is no longer used and can be removed. Should it be needed in the
future the code is very similiar to CentOS. As is it will just become out of
date as the code is never excersied.

Change-Id: I7df832e5b0830ac8b4507f000ed8ed6e43d39463
Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate

commit_message:
Wrapper is used instead of direct json library.

jsonutils library is wrapper for json library.
Also it has taken care of py27 and py34 compatibility.

Apart from this json.dumps() has diffrent behaviour
in py27 and py34. It add extra space in py27 but not
in py34.

Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-py3
Change-Id: I7e4754e7e695ad6a327cd54ecd47e8434978cd27

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-30 12:05:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix incorrect passing port dict in pluggable IPAM

_ipam_allocate_ips expects to receive port dict as a third argument, but
'changes' were passed instead.

This issue affects only third-party vendors who implement own IPAM
driver with custom AddressRequestFactory and uses port dict in it.

Updated arguments passed to _ipam_allocate_ips to include port dict as a
third argument.

Change-Id: I25eb86f46e5412cfacad9a751a94f7720f1a7bd0
Closes-Bug: #1511707
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-02 14:18:00.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/ipam_pluggable_backend.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ipam_pluggable_backend.py'], 'message': "Fix incorrect passing port dict in pluggable IPAM

_ipam_allocate_ips expects to receive port dict as a third argument, but
'changes' were passed instead.

This issue affects only third-party vendors who implement own IPAM
driver with custom AddressRequestFactory and uses port dict in it.

Updated arguments passed to _ipam_allocate_ips to include port dict as a
third argument.

Change-Id: I25eb86f46e5412cfacad9a751a94f7720f1a7bd0
Closes-Bug: #1511707
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect passing port dict in pluggable IPAM

_ipam_allocate_ips expects to receive port dict as a third argument, but
'changes' were passed instead.

This issue affects only third-party vendors who implement own IPAM
driver with custom AddressRequestFactory and uses port dict in it.

Updated arguments passed to _ipam_allocate_ips to include port dict as a
third argument.

Change-Id: I25eb86f46e5412cfacad9a751a94f7720f1a7bd0
Closes-Bug: #1511707

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-02 12:33:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add new repo for Smaug
Application Data Protection as a Service for OpenStack
Our mission statement is:
* Formalize Application Data Protection in OpenStack (APIs, Services,
Plugins, …)
* Be able to protect Any Resource in OpenStack (as well as their dependencies)
* Allow Diversity of vendor solutions, capabilities and implementations
without compromising usability

* Open Architecture
** Vendors create plugins that implement Protection mechanisms for different
OpenStack resources
* User perspective: Protect App Deployment
** Configure and manage custom protection plans on the deployed resources
(topology, VMs, volumes, images, …)
* Admin perspective: Define Protectable Resources
** Decide what plugins protect which resources, what is available for the user
** Decide where users can protect their resources

Change-Id: Ic104634b7cf49c9a3e07b16d5faada248f5b1789

* Admin perspective: Define Protectable Resources
** Decide what plugins protect which resources, what is available for the user
** Decide where users can protect their resources

Change-Id: Ic104634b7cf49c9a3e07b16d5faada248f5b1789
', 'number': 4}]
commit_message:
Add new repo for Smaug

Application Data Protection as a Service for OpenStack
Our mission statement is:
* Formalize Application Data Protection in OpenStack (APIs, Services,
Plugins, …)
* Be able to protect Any Resource in OpenStack (as well as their dependencies)
* Allow Diversity of vendor solutions, capabilities and implementations
without compromising usability

* Open Architecture
** Vendors create plugins that implement Protection mechanisms for different
OpenStack resources
* User perspective: Protect App Deployment
** Configure and manage custom protection plans on the deployed resources
(topology, VMs, volumes, images, …)
* Admin perspective: Define Protectable Resources
** Decide what plugins protect which resources, what is available for the user
** Decide where users can protect their resources

Change-Id: Ic104634b7cf49c9a3e07b16d5faada248f5b1789

using registry v2 in image-building doc

It will fail when pushing images to registry v1 using docker-py 1.5.
Use more recent docker registry.

These cases are created using Orthogonal array testing technique with
the following procedure in order to gurantee the coverage.

* create cases, combinations above parameters and values, then map to
  the test schema for functional test
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/406343/
* summarize the cases
  (No.1-5, No.7-10, No.13-15, No.17, No.26-28, No.31 in Table A) *
  (No.1-2, No.4, No.6, No.8-13 in Table D) +

  (No.1-2, No.4, No.6, No.8-13 in Table D) +

  (No.3 in Table B) * (No.6 in Table D) +
  (No.2-6 in Table C) * (No.3 in Table B) * (No.6 in Table D)

  such as PUT, GET and so on for easier review

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-06 04:25:04.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/container.py'], 'message': 'Restrict account_autocreate behavior with allow_account_management

allow_account_management in proxy-server.conf is used for controlling
account creation and deletion.
If allow_account_management is false (default), nobody can create/delete
accounts.
But if account_autocreate in proxy-server.conf is true and then put
container comes to proxy servers, an account will be created.

This patch restricts the behavior.

Change-Id: I82b0a5e5fd20ae8b28497139a543f8b480769f7a
Closes-Bug: #1482041
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Restrict account_autocreate behavior with allow_account_management

allow_account_management in proxy-server.conf is used for controlling
account creation and deletion.
If allow_account_management is false (default), nobody can create/delete
accounts.
But if account_autocreate in proxy-server.conf is true and then put
container comes to proxy servers, an account will be created.

This patch restricts the behavior.

Change-Id: I82b0a5e5fd20ae8b28497139a543f8b480769f7a
Closes-Bug: #1482041

commit_message:
Detection plugin for Barbican service

Detects Barbican daemons and setup configuration for monitoring. Default
values for service_api_url, process_names and search_pattern are
provided. Allows overriding the default values via the args parameter.

Updated 'service_name'  to 'key-manager'

Change-Id: Iadac18bcd700f5f7e1749b7a234fbb5438c56892

subject: Remove some unecessary text_type transforms
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-27 01:10:49.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/metering/tables.py', 'horizon/tabs/base.py', 'horizon/tables/base.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/keystone.py'], 'message': 'Remove some unecessary text_type transforms

These uses of text_type:

py2: convert a str to unicode in situations where
the unicode will just be converted back to str by
Python (ie. attribute names or __str__ return
values) and if high-bit unicode was ever present
then Python would throw a UnicodeEncodeError when
unable to encode the unicode to ASCII.

py3: convert a str to str (ie. a no-op)

Also removed a test for text.slugify (our minimum
Django version always has it) and the unnecessary
text_type call there too.

Change-Id: I529be1ac09581548a8aca604c55ab96637bcc737
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove some unecessary text_type transforms

These uses of text_type:

py2: convert a str to unicode in situations where
the unicode will just be converted back to str by
Python (ie. attribute names or __str__ return
values) and if high-bit unicode was ever present
then Python would throw a UnicodeEncodeError when
unable to encode the unicode to ASCII.

py3: convert a str to str (ie. a no-op)

Also removed a test for text.slugify (our minimum
Django version always has it) and the unnecessary
text_type call there too.

Change-Id: I529be1ac09581548a8aca604c55ab96637bcc737

commit_message:
Make sure dashboard has a default panel group

According to the Horizon documentation for Settings and Configuration,
for a plugin panel, 'If you want the panel to show up without a panel
group, use the panel group “default”'. In some cases, plugin panels were
getting put under the panel group "Other" instead. This is because
the default panel group wasn't getting created during plugin panel
processing when the panel's dashboard class already had some panel
groups defined. Fix this by making sure a default panel group is created
in each dashboard.

Change-Id: I98064c434326aabec16b5d1631e360643609ed40
Closes-Bug: 1403094

commit_message:
Add more informative error during parsing

If there is some error during parsing template or
env file, CSafeLoader errors doesn't contains snippet
from template. So, we need to use SafeLoader for more
informative error with snippet from parsed template.

Change-Id: I79039164533c032db66c933c4e8882b8942961eb
Related-bug: #1496361
(cherry picked from commit b41739a63ed915a763d9102865056ee540477917)

commit_message:
Allow get_attr: [res_name] format to get all attribute

Don't check None attribute name if want to get all
attributes of resource, and this only works in template
'2015-10-15' or higher version.

Change-Id: I6699bfc8bc8096e5dc313d01b3a829694c105fea
Closes-Bug: #1505560
(cherry picked from commit 1240c33a3ffc887378011e1d171036c575444ba0)

commit_message:

port when prepare for update replace.

commit_message:
Fix handling of FAILED ResourceGroup members on rolling update

Ensure that any members of a ResourceGroup that are in a FAILED state are
still included in the generated template during a rolling update, so that
Heat will replace them in the nested stack.

Change-Id: I1806d3160c364b0942934eb8b43614f17b98bacb
Closes-Bug: #1508736
(cherry picked from commit c56c326c1fea06994a751147f94144763eb324c7)

commit_message:
Remove 'mkdir cloud-01 && cd cloud-01 && tempest init'

In tempest's readme doc,it tells 'tempest init cloud-01' works the
same as 'mkdir cloud-01 && cd cloud-01 && tempest init'.But since
change I960bc711ff78ac2b0441ef63dff8ec4fb268fd3a,we can't use a
existed directory to initialize a tempest environment.The readme doc
has not been updated yet.
Also change some sentences to help understand.

Change-Id: I0e3e681732f73a2f45aafc9752e1b00ef944c2ad
Closes-Bug: #1512628

Co-Authored-By: Augustina Ragwitz <aragwitz+lp@pobox.com>
Change-Id: Id4a2f73cbcfcf36aea750375fd92b1c2d3cd824e', 'number': 12}, {'created': '2015-10-21 14:22:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'make project_id optional in urls for version discovery

Currently there is a baked in assumption throughout the nova ecosystem
that endpoint urls will end in {project_id}.

This means that the version document for a specific major API version
is "endpoint - last_chunk_of_url". This is not a discoverable URL,
it's one that we heuristically generate.

GET /v2.1/{project_id} is a 404.

If we make Nova able to handle endpoint ids without {project_id} we
run into a problem with novaclient, which is that end_point is now
/v2.1. The heuristic gives us a version url of /. Which returns a very
different doc than /v2.1. This causes all novaclient commands to explode.

In order to support this transition we need to make both Nova and
Novaclient handle endpoints with and without {project_id}.

The proposal is thus to try the raw value of the endpoint first. If it
works, great. If it fails with a 404, fall back to the heuristics.

While this change and the nova change are technically independent, we
should land this one as soon as possible, because clients before this
change will not work with Nova deploys that get rid of project_id in
their service catalog in the future.

Part of bp:service-catalog-tng

Co-Authored-By: Augustina Ragwitz <aragwitz+lp@pobox.com>
Change-Id: Id4a2f73cbcfcf36aea750375fd92b1c2d3cd824e

commit_message:
make project_id optional in urls for version discovery

Currently there is a baked in assumption throughout the nova ecosystem
that endpoint urls will end in {project_id}.

This means that the version document for a specific major API version
is "endpoint - last_chunk_of_url". This is not a discoverable URL,
it's one that we heuristically generate.

GET /v2.1/{project_id} is a 404.

If we make Nova able to handle endpoint ids without {project_id} we
run into a problem with novaclient, which is that end_point is now
/v2.1. The heuristic gives us a version url of /. Which returns a very
different doc than /v2.1. This causes all novaclient commands to explode.

In order to support this transition we need to make both Nova and
Novaclient handle endpoints with and without {project_id}.

The proposal is thus to try the raw value of the endpoint first. If it
works, great. If it fails with a 404, fall back to the heuristics.

While this change and the nova change are technically independent, we
should land this one as soon as possible, because clients before this
change will not work with Nova deploys that get rid of project_id in
their service catalog in the future.

Part of bp:service-catalog-tng

Co-Authored-By: Augustina Ragwitz <aragwitz+lp@pobox.com>
Change-Id: Id4a2f73cbcfcf36aea750375fd92b1c2d3cd824e

commit_message:
Fix uniqueness check of initrd in fedora-minimal

The check suffered from various flaws.

First, due to missing quotes around $initrd, 'wc -l' would always see
1 line no matter how many results the find returned.

Second, echo adds a line break making 'wc -l' count 1 even for empty
string. We need to add a check for empty string.

Change-Id: Ib2c67960f566dbdc471d9585a4cef1beb1cc38ab
Closes-Bug: #1506692

commit_message:
libvirt: implement get_device_name_for_instance

We implement the method above with the purpose of using the
nova.libvirt.blockinfo primitives (which match how libvirt itself works),
to decide on which device name to use for an instance.

With this change - we will be using the libvirt local logic to decide on
the volume device name instead of relying on
nova.compute.utils.get_device_name_for_instance() which will do wrong
things in a number of cases.

Closes-bug: 1452224
Related-bug: 1231874

Change-Id: I33d7363c018fc4e5e9f190486d5556363852badb
(cherry picked from commit c5db407bb22e453a4bca22de1860bb6ce6090782)

[{'created': '2015-09-30 20:37:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Always default device names at boot

Up until now, libvirt would default it's own device names unless they
were specified by the user at boot. This could lead to inconsistencies,
so the soft approach was to discourage users from passing in explicit
device names, by documenting the fact that they will not be honoured,
 but not override them.

It turns out that this approach causes more trouble, especially when we
add attaching volumes into the mix. So the approach now is to make
libvirt _always_ override what is passed in. That way even if the user
specifies a device name, the attach will not fail due to a device name
collision (a common problem - see related bug), and Nova book keeping

In order to get there we now make sure boot starts acting like that
before we switch attach_volume over too, so that there is consistent
behavior.

Also - make tests for defaulting device names more realistic as they now
actually run the code instead of just making sure the right methods get
called.

UpgradeImpact: After this commit, supplying a device name for any of
the block devices specified as part of the `nova boot` call will not be
honoured by any libvirt compute nodes.

Change-Id: I76a7cfd995db6c04f7af48ff8c9acdd55750ed76
Related-bug: #1075971
(cherry picked from commit 0283234e837d9faf807e6e8da6ec6321ee56b31a)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Always default device names at boot

Up until now, libvirt would default it's own device names unless they
were specified by the user at boot. This could lead to inconsistencies,
so the soft approach was to discourage users from passing in explicit
device names, by documenting the fact that they will not be honoured,
 but not override them.

It turns out that this approach causes more trouble, especially when we
add attaching volumes into the mix. So the approach now is to make
libvirt _always_ override what is passed in. That way even if the user
specifies a device name, the attach will not fail due to a device name
collision (a common problem - see related bug), and Nova book keeping
will match what we can see in the instance on most OSes.

In order to get there we now make sure boot starts acting like that
before we switch attach_volume over too, so that there is consistent
behavior.

Also - make tests for defaulting device names more realistic as they now
actually run the code instead of just making sure the right methods get
called.

UpgradeImpact: After this commit, supplying a device name for any of
the block devices specified as part of the `nova boot` call will not be
honoured by any libvirt compute nodes.

Change-Id: I76a7cfd995db6c04f7af48ff8c9acdd55750ed76
Related-bug: #1075971
(cherry picked from commit 0283234e837d9faf807e6e8da6ec6321ee56b31a)

subject: virt: add get_device_name_for_instance to the base driver class
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-30 20:37:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/virt/driver.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_virt_drivers.py'], 'message': 'virt: add get_device_name_for_instance to the base driver class

Just as libvirt needs to decide on the device names when booting an
instance (as opposed to them being assigned by the user), the same needs
to be done when attaching additional volumes to a running instance.

This patch exposes it on the ComputeDriver base class and makes sure
that it will be called by the compute manager (and that an appropriate
fallback will happen if the drivers do not care about overriding this),
as a pre-req for doing the work in the libvirt driver.

Partial-bug: 1452224
Related-bug: 1231874

Conflicts:
        nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to 91b35b22e dropping compute RPC
3.x support in Liberty where return_bdm_object was dropped from the
reserve_block_device_name method.

Change-Id: I66693a8a6a632b65f930a58905336397ac6c9f29
(cherry picked from commit b6733dbdf3d04f4e334f1aeb6ee7ce4b6d1b7b95)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
virt: add get_device_name_for_instance to the base driver class

Just as libvirt needs to decide on the device names when booting an
instance (as opposed to them being assigned by the user), the same needs
to be done when attaching additional volumes to a running instance.

This patch exposes it on the ComputeDriver base class and makes sure
that it will be called by the compute manager (and that an appropriate
fallback will happen if the drivers do not care about overriding this),
as a pre-req for doing the work in the libvirt driver.

Partial-bug: 1452224
Related-bug: 1231874

Conflicts:
        nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to 91b35b22e dropping compute RPC
3.x support in Liberty where return_bdm_object was dropped from the
reserve_block_device_name method.

Change-Id: I66693a8a6a632b65f930a58905336397ac6c9f29
(cherry picked from commit b6733dbdf3d04f4e334f1aeb6ee7ce4b6d1b7b95)

commit_message:
libvirt: make default_device_names DRY-er

Since we now have a reusable method to call to get the block_device_info
structure that most driver code is designed to work with, we don't need
to re-write it in the blockinfo code - we can just use it.

In addition to this - this fixes a (yet unreported) issue that libvirt
would not consider blank volumes in it's device assignments.

Related-bug: 1231874
Partial-bug: 1452224

Change-Id: I4b9a6fd1b08ff787fdd1226f533f4181fe44b7e9
(cherry picked from commit fb3d3773a2c2b07af2849608f1481c9f37a9ec62)

commit_message:
virt: Move building the block_device_info dict into a method

The block_device_info structure is needed in several places, so it's
useful to move it into a method and remove the code repetition that is
all over the place.

Also make sure there is a single way to get the legacy dict format for
the drivers that need this (however at this point we should probably
remove that soon, and convert all the in-tree drivers to expect the new
format).

Related-bug: 1231874
Partial-bug: 1452224

Change-Id: I608042c58c04f333f6fbb8d9824eb8f3913c6310
(cherry picked from commit 94a5793d63a797697fb1f937340cb49b3c7e9787)

commit_message:
virt: make sure convert_all_volumes catches blank volumes too

convert_all_volumes would skip over blanks. This patch makes sure it
will consider them now too.

The patch (42ea00ee) that introduces the method for some reason
completely missed the Blank volume type.

Closes-bug: #1451950

Change-Id: I146a9bb09c149db1bab6dc13c082b00e5de8b764
(cherry picked from commit 13ce6b5eff303fc544ba61ee19f66dbfabc6e20c)

commit_message:
compute utils: Remove a useless context parameter

get_device_name_for_instance used to require a context to be passed in
explicitly, but this is no longer required, so this patch removes it
from the signature.

Change-Id: I076c377199ce3d17541a772544dfb4d9bc4df2e9
(cherry picked from commit 51bdf76b501edae18b251adfa0163236455e15f5)

commit_message:
Update Vagrant configuration to deploy 3-node OVN setup

This updates the Vagrant setup to deploy a 3-node Ubuntu Trusty
setup (1 control node, 2 compute nodes). The Vivid image this
was previously trying to download was HUGE, and it's not clear
why running on Vivid is better considering the gate uses
Trusty.

Also, adjust the names of the nodes this spawns to be a bit
more sane. They are now spawned as:

ovn-controller
ovn-compute1
ovn-compute2

One final change adds some additional configuration into
local.conf which allows this all to come up and run.

Closes-Bug: #1499917
Change-Id: Ife6cfbe18ea1053ca52b8ff0f074987c178a713c
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

commit_message:
cells: add debug logging to bdm_update_or_create_at_top

The method is racy and we need to know which conditions we're hitting
when we fail, which is happening sometimes with the
test_create_ebs_image_and_check_boot test in Tempest.

We fail because the image snapshot metadata has duplicate BDM entries in
it so that when we boot an instance from that image, there are multiple
BDMs with the same boot_index and nova.compute.api.API._validate_bdm
throws up.

Related-Bug: #1489581

Change-Id: I8058e0c16e0fd9b54d4a46e86e0fdede3da55777

commit_message:
Remove kube-register

kubelet has already the ablitity to register node with --register-node
option which defaults to true if --api-server is set [1], so we don't
need kube-register now.

Change-Id: I5899e3a457e799fac42593f82ce69d0def593d43
Closes-Bug: #1511281

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-04 22:05:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py'], 'message': 'Handle empty bridge case in OVSBridge.get_ports_attributes

Before this patch, get_ports_attributes would call
get_port_name_list. In the case of an empty bridge,
get_port_name_list would return an empty list and feed that
in to ovsdb.db_list, thereby returning all ports instead of
no ports.

Closes-Bug: #1499821
(cherry picked from commit 9c3e3a0fcee012ee0187b19931d63927379a621f)

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: I5a91028c59d71943b7cef86a94fa6ab1cc3d667c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Handle empty bridge case in OVSBridge.get_ports_attributes

Before this patch, get_ports_attributes would call
get_port_name_list. In the case of an empty bridge,
get_port_name_list would return an empty list and feed that
in to ovsdb.db_list, thereby returning all ports instead of
no ports.

Closes-Bug: #1499821
(cherry picked from commit 9c3e3a0fcee012ee0187b19931d63927379a621f)

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: I5a91028c59d71943b7cef86a94fa6ab1cc3d667c

commit_message:
require nova account in nova_admin_tenant_id_setter

Make sure that the nova account is granted sufficient privileges before
nova_admin_tenant_id_setter tries to use it to list tenant ids.

Closes-Bug: 1512930

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-29 23:26:38.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/libvirt.py', 'monasca_agent/common/util.py'], 'message': "Allow config file 'instances' to be empty

be an empty list.

An example of where this is necessary is the libvirt plugin, where
it is unreasonable to have all VMs enumerated as 'instances' in the
.yaml file, but are instead provided by the hypervisor.

The libvirt plugin itself needed a minor modification to work with
empty instances.  These changes are necessitated by the monasca-setup
change https://review.openstack.org/239815

Change-Id: Idc67df9e5d9195f65fe16b9d67478e1de8e61eb3
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Allow config file 'instances' to be empty

This change allows slightly more lenient processing of Agent config
files, where 'instances' is still required in the .yaml file, but may
be an empty list.

An example of where this is necessary is the libvirt plugin, where
it is unreasonable to have all VMs enumerated as 'instances' in the
.yaml file, but are instead provided by the hypervisor.

The libvirt plugin itself needed a minor modification to work with
empty instances.  These changes are necessitated by the monasca-setup
change https://review.openstack.org/239815

Change-Id: Idc67df9e5d9195f65fe16b9d67478e1de8e61eb3

commit_message:
no finalize step for glance in Debian

There's no need to manually restart glance on Debian after installation
so this patch fixes this (removing the "Finalize installation" step
completely from the Debian install-guide).

Change-Id: I4e2558fdf40da8d7361f96372079ea6efdbf8329

commit_message:
Revised client interface

This is an effort to make the interface exposed by senlinclient more
usable for other software. Eventually, all these logic will go to
either openstackclient or openstacksdk, but for now we keep it locally
to make things work.

Change-Id: I25fdb0f3bb224951256ccb0eeafa09e906195805

commit_message:
Use 'baremetal' service tag to run Ironic grenade

Uses the 'baremetal' service tag to run only the relevant grenade tests
for grenade-dsvm-partial-ironic. This makes it consistent with the other
Ironic test jobs.

Partial-Bug: #1512544
Change-Id: I5aff02c0bdf0eb62782298185a4b763af782b160
Depends-On: I250e2d27af21ffbc017f96938641276f17a9b926

commit_message:
Update desc in /NetworkDriver.Join json schema

Now through 'join' containers will be able to connect to multiple
networks with an endpoint in each network. There is no 'service' abstraction
now.

Change-Id: I48f21b2ca7d907b6c8aad14daf52dbb391fcd6d5
Closes-bug: #1507451

subject: Combine k8s api tests into one
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-23 20:54:44.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/functional/test_k8s_python_client.py'], 'message': 'Combine k8s api tests into one

The functional gate will create a bay for each test. There are six
tests in TestKubernetesAPIs, so six bays are created. This is
unnecessary. We can create one bay and let all the k8s tests run on
that bay.

Change-Id: I0d7f2b9352e21761d55b739cc6f63b8eef3d7074
Closes-Bug: #1509538
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Combine k8s api tests into one

The functional gate will create a bay for each test. There are six
tests in TestKubernetesAPIs, so six bays are created. This is
unnecessary. We can create one bay and let all the k8s tests run on
that bay.

Change-Id: I0d7f2b9352e21761d55b739cc6f63b8eef3d7074
Closes-Bug: #1509538

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-26 20:55:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make Interface information optional

Create network may or may not contain information about one
or more interfaces. Make the schema allow that.

Change-Id: I7dafd1d0dfda23ebefa07a8cec3d6db9a4270194
Partial-Bug: #1499779
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-30 12:58:11.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr/schemata/endpoint_create.py'], 'message': 'Make Interface information optional

Create endpoint may or may not contain information about one
or more interfaces. As is, the interface is required for creating
the endpoint by the schema. This fix allows for the case where no
interface is specified by removing Interfaces from the required
list.

Change-Id: I7dafd1d0dfda23ebefa07a8cec3d6db9a4270194
Partial-Bug: #1499779
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Make Interface information optional

Create endpoint may or may not contain information about one
or more interfaces. As is, the interface is required for creating
the endpoint by the schema. This fix allows for the case where no
interface is specified by removing Interfaces from the required
list.

Change-Id: I7dafd1d0dfda23ebefa07a8cec3d6db9a4270194
Partial-Bug: #1499779

commit_message:
Refactor status and admin state translation code

In some of the dashboard 'views.py' files, there is code that enables
the detail status and, when applicable, admin state labels to be
translated.  The current coding style of these sections is hard
to read.  Any and all sections of code that use this style should
be refactored to enhance the code readability.  This change
proposes to create a single utility method that handles this
repetitive code block that is used in many places.  Thus to perform
the translation label lookup, this method need only be called.  This
method will provide a single clean and consistent code block that can
be used for any of these situations in the future.

Change-Id: I6353abef58fc2a481d4379eb1a2f8289d7f1790b
Closes-Bug: #1490031

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-04 20:40:46.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/cache-devstack/install.d/60-pip-warm-cache'], 'message': 'Revert "warm pip wheel cache during image build"

Turns out we can't do this without dirtying our images by
preinstalling all the libraries/headers our requirements want to
link against. We should revisit the wheel mirror solution which has
already been written as a saner solution.

This reverts commit 1503ef327817bd42cbf888e773f5639e660169a7.

Change-Id: I69ea73b6eb4b620f1ac77467ee3784ec3c813ee2
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "warm pip wheel cache during image build"

Turns out we can't do this without dirtying our images by
preinstalling all the libraries/headers our requirements want to
link against. We should revisit the wheel mirror solution which has
already been written as a saner solution.

This reverts commit 1503ef327817bd42cbf888e773f5639e660169a7.

Change-Id: I69ea73b6eb4b620f1ac77467ee3784ec3c813ee2

commit_message:
Factorize field definition of declarative code

Currently we have three differents parts of code that parse samples
and notifications. All of them do the same thing.
The event one have some additionals feature "TraitPlugin".

This change removes the code duplication and allows to use TraitPlugin
into gnocchi and meter definitions.

commit_message:
use assertIs(Not)None instead of assert(Not)Equal

Instead of using assert(Not)Equal(None, ***), developers should
use assertIs(Not)None(***). This patch fixes the same in LBaaS.

Related-Bug: #1503055

subject: mitaka: release python-novaclient 2.34.0
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-28 18:52:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'mitaka: release python-novaclient 3.0.0

Where to start...

6bda37f498f5ecb262dbb5d27c3f1ff8a47369d8 requested 2.33.0 which we
needed to get 28bf8dd released.

The 2.33.0 tag is on a5363ae0d60d41feff23f6cca44fcd7aa9fc5b8b so we
wouldn't pick up 0cd5812 which removes the novaclient.v1_1 module and is
a backward incompatible change.

However, 2.33.0 contained 2961e82 which was also a backward incompatible
change, which was reverted with 63c7a57.

There are changes up to block 2.33.0 in global-requirements:

I6e7657b60308b30eed89b269810c1f37cce43063

Now we want to release a new version to include that revert but since it
comes after the change that removes the novaclient.v1_1 module, which is
backward incompatible, we have to release with a major version bump to
3.0.0.

So effectively this gets us back to using these changes in the gate once
2.33.0 is blocked by g-r:

mriedem@ubuntu:~/git/python-novaclient$ git log --oneline --no-merges
2.32.0..
63c7a57 Revert "Do not expose exceptions from requests library"
217e7c1 Updated from global requirements
2961e82 Do not expose exceptions from requests library
cce7cd3 Support the server side remote-console API changes
28bf8dd Correct usage of API_MAX_VERSION and
DEFAULT_OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION
727f104 Rely on devstack for clouds.yaml
262719d Updated from global requirements
1c401ed Updated from global requirements
a820c45 Use v2.0 in clouds.yaml auth_url for functional test job
afaa8a2 Increase timeout when testing admin timeout
d10486f Fix incorrect help for 'nova flavor-create'
0cd5812 Remove novaclient.v1_1 module

Related-Bug: #1510790
Related-Bug: #1508244

Change-Id: I4fc044e518a5cc5ea7b309a2824984a7035945bd
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-29 14:02:18.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/mitaka/python-novaclient.yaml'], 'message': 'mitaka: release python-novaclient 2.34.0

Where to start...

6bda37f498f5ecb262dbb5d27c3f1ff8a47369d8 requested 2.33.0 which we
needed to get 28bf8dd released.

The 2.33.0 tag is on a5363ae0d60d41feff23f6cca44fcd7aa9fc5b8b so we
wouldn't pick up 0cd5812 which removes the novaclient.v1_1 module and is
a backward incompatible change.

However, 2.33.0 contained 2961e82 which was also a backward incompatible
change, which was reverted with 63c7a57.

2.33.0 has been blacklisted from global-requirements:

I6e7657b60308b30eed89b269810c1f37cce43063

Now we want to release a new version to include that revert. Note that
we reverted the removal of the novaclient.v1_1 module since that would
have also been a backward incompatible change. We reverted that so we
could release this as 2.34 with bug fixes. Once this is released we'll
redo the removal of the novaclient.v1_1 module and release that as
3.0.0.

Changes since 2.33.0:

mriedem@ubuntu:~/git/python-novaclient$ git log --oneline --no-merges
2.33.0..
036d42d Revert "Remove novaclient.v1_1 module"
63c7a57 Revert "Do not expose exceptions from requests library"
217e7c1 Updated from global requirements
0cd5812 Remove novaclient.v1_1 module

Related-Bug: #1510790

Change-Id: I4fc044e518a5cc5ea7b309a2824984a7035945bd
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
mitaka: release python-novaclient 2.34.0

Where to start...

6bda37f498f5ecb262dbb5d27c3f1ff8a47369d8 requested 2.33.0 which we
needed to get 28bf8dd released.

The 2.33.0 tag is on a5363ae0d60d41feff23f6cca44fcd7aa9fc5b8b so we
wouldn't pick up 0cd5812 which removes the novaclient.v1_1 module and is
a backward incompatible change.

However, 2.33.0 contained 2961e82 which was also a backward incompatible
change, which was reverted with 63c7a57.

2.33.0 has been blacklisted from global-requirements:

I6e7657b60308b30eed89b269810c1f37cce43063

Now we want to release a new version to include that revert. Note that
we reverted the removal of the novaclient.v1_1 module since that would
have also been a backward incompatible change. We reverted that so we
could release this as 2.34 with bug fixes. Once this is released we'll
redo the removal of the novaclient.v1_1 module and release that as
3.0.0.

Changes since 2.33.0:

mriedem@ubuntu:~/git/python-novaclient$ git log --oneline --no-merges
2.33.0..
036d42d Revert "Remove novaclient.v1_1 module"
63c7a57 Revert "Do not expose exceptions from requests library"
217e7c1 Updated from global requirements
0cd5812 Remove novaclient.v1_1 module

Related-Bug: #1510790

Change-Id: I4fc044e518a5cc5ea7b309a2824984a7035945bd

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-04 14:04:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove deprecated methods

Commit 8022adb7342b09886f53c91c12d0b37986fbf35c marked the
methods read_cached_file, find_config_file and

commit_message:
Update deprecated messages

Commit 8022adb7342b09886f53c91c12d0b37986fbf35c marked the
methods read_cached_file, find_config_file and
get_keystone_url as not used in Liberty.

This code only landed a few days ago. Updated the deprecated
message to be after Mitaka so that external plugins will have
some grace period to clean up their code.

Change-Id: Ia5ce564837c4855450aa9da94c276e4beb62900c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 2475, 'name': 'Antoine Musso', 'email': 'hashar@free.fr', 'username': 'hashar'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 4330, 'name': 'Tomas Sedovic', 'email': 'tsedovic@redhat.com', 'username': 'tomas-8c8'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 9268, 'name': 'Gonéri Le Bouder', 'email': 'goneri@redhat.com', 'username': 'goneri'}, {'_account_id': 10035, 'name': 'greghaynes', 'email': 'greg@greghaynes.net', 'username': 'greghaynes'}, {'_account_id': 10290, 'name': 'Jonathan Brownell', 'email': 'cadenzajon@gmail.com', 'username': 'cadenzajon'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-30 21:41:14.000000000', 'files': ['elements/debian/install.d/10-cloud-opinions'], 'message': 'debian: cloud hostname ignored by Jessie

5af25b5f fixed the hostname of Debian images to "debian" since a lack of
hostname definition set the hostname to "(None)".

It has been done by introducing /etc/cloud/cloud.cfg.d/01_hostname.cfg
with content:

  hostname: debian

Review supposed the hostname would be overriden by cloud meta-data. That
might have stand true for Wheezy but it is not the case for Jessie.

cloud-init 0.7.6 ignores cloud metadata whenever "hostname" or "fqdn"
are set in a config file. Roughly:

    # no fqdn set, get fqdn from cloud
    # get hostname from cfg if available otherwise cloud
    fqdn = cloud.get_hostname(fqdn=True)
    if "hostname" in cfg:
        # hashar: set from config file NOT cloud
        hostname = cfg['hostname']
    else:
        # fallback to cloud
        hostname = cloud.get_hostname()

Relevant code is
https://github.com/number5/cloud-init/blob/0.7.6/cloudinit/util.py#L839-L860

Only inject "hostname: debian" for the Wheezy release.

Bug: https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T117283
Change-Id: I6e2522bd725cbf9651f11c76ecdc72ecbc92f402
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
debian: cloud hostname ignored by Jessie

5af25b5f fixed the hostname of Debian images to "debian" since a lack of
hostname definition set the hostname to "(None)".

It has been done by introducing /etc/cloud/cloud.cfg.d/01_hostname.cfg
with content:

  hostname: debian

Review supposed the hostname would be overriden by cloud meta-data. That
might have stand true for Wheezy but it is not the case for Jessie.

cloud-init 0.7.6 ignores cloud metadata whenever "hostname" or "fqdn"
are set in a config file. Roughly:

    # no fqdn set, get fqdn from cloud
    # get hostname from cfg if available otherwise cloud
    fqdn = cloud.get_hostname(fqdn=True)
    if "hostname" in cfg:
        # hashar: set from config file NOT cloud
        hostname = cfg['hostname']
    else:
        # fallback to cloud
        hostname = cloud.get_hostname()

Relevant code is
https://github.com/number5/cloud-init/blob/0.7.6/cloudinit/util.py#L839-L860

Only inject "hostname: debian" for the Wheezy release.

Bug: https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T117283
Change-Id: I6e2522bd725cbf9651f11c76ecdc72ecbc92f402

commit_message:
Fixes order of argument in assertEqual

Some tests in designateclient used incorrect
argument order in assertEqual(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Partial-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
Ability to test oslo master libraries against liberty services

During the Tokyo summit discussions, there were concerns raised
about backward compatability guarantees with oslo libraries. The
main reason was that in liberty global-requirements we do not
cap the versions for oslo libraries and any oslo release in
support of mitaka is likely to break the stable/liberty branch.
We need to add additional jobs to make sure a change in oslo
library in master does not break liberty.

We had this support earlier which was removed in change id:
Ia40d8cbf8cef803617509aeca20a9f1ec79d0880

We cannot just revert that change since a lot of changes have
happened since April. We should run this new job against master
as a check job and also should not vote until next summit.

Change-Id: Idcbb3e8c71b0be97c7ab78c426ac363388f46633

commit_message:
Change haproxy namespace driver to use stevedore alias

This changes haproxy namespace driver to use stevedore alias
rather than full module name for vif driver.

Also fixes 'default argument should not be mutable'
pep8 error.

Change-Id: I6fb779ca9de7ef999505fb4539a3180ecd5ea280
Closes-Bug: #1512937

commit_message:
Optimize get_bridge_for_tap_device

Currently get_bridge_for_tap_device[1] iterates over all neutron bridges
and their interfaces.

This change proposes to deduce interface bridge from:

 /sys/class/net/%(interface)s/brif/bridge

which is a symlink to bridge interface path to improve performance.

[1] neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.linuxbridge.agent.linuxbridge_neutron_agent

Closes-Bug: #1508789
Change-Id: Ia40cd81f47ff082a90d17f58514942ec50553241
(cherry picked from commit 75c881a748941bc6637f3eb10dd5828f32ec6830)
Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l2_lb_agent.py

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-03 15:02:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Use string formatting instead of string replace

Currently linuxbridge_neutron_agent[1] uses the pattern:

 PLACEHOLDER = "..."
 PATH = PREFIX + PLACEHOLDER + SUFFIX
 ...
 my_path = PATH.replace(PLACEHOLDER, my_value)

which could be replaced by the following which is more common and in
general safer:

 PATH = PREFIX + '%s' + SUFFIX
 ...
 my_path = PATH % my_value)

Change-Id: I2d23b11fa6fb7f31c1abbe36523b75bfc81f5c46
(cherry picked from commit a4170cf1bfd3939f54be178e32a258709cc0f76c)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use string formatting instead of string replace

Currently linuxbridge_neutron_agent[1] uses the pattern:

 PLACEHOLDER = "..."
 PATH = PREFIX + PLACEHOLDER + SUFFIX
 ...
 my_path = PATH.replace(PLACEHOLDER, my_value)

which could be replaced by the following which is more common and in
general safer:

 PATH = PREFIX + '%s' + SUFFIX
 ...
 my_path = PATH % my_value)

Change-Id: I2d23b11fa6fb7f31c1abbe36523b75bfc81f5c46
(cherry picked from commit a4170cf1bfd3939f54be178e32a258709cc0f76c)

commit_message:
Prepare neutron "use_namespaces" option removal

The neutron use_namespaces option is deprecated since Kilo, it's time
remove it from neutron, neutron-*aas and devstack. This change removes
use_namespaces option usage in unit/functional tests in order to prepare
option removal from neutron and tests testing use_namespace=False case.
This change continues to define use_namespaces option because it's
required by neutron code without using neutron
register_use_namespaces_opts_helper which will be removed from neutron.

Related-Bug: #1508188
Change-Id: I303038eec560a6d99421140c2822aed8b518470b

subject: Added CORS support to Designate
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-19 17:49:16.000000000', 'files': ['etc/designate/api-paste.ini'], 'message': 'Added CORS support to Designate

This adds the CORS support middleware to Designate, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

The paste.ini method of deploying the middleware was
chosen, because it needs to be able to annotate error responses
created by other middlewares. If one such middleware throws an
error - such as an auth error from keystone - that error response
must still have CORS headers in order to be readable by the
user agent.

openstack-config-generator hooks were not added in this patch, as
it does not appear that designate explicitly supports them.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html

Change-Id: Ib66e8afafbde568549228c98d210f02466a90cc8
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Added CORS support to Designate

This adds the CORS support middleware to Designate, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

The paste.ini method of deploying the middleware was
chosen, because it needs to be able to annotate error responses
created by other middlewares. If one such middleware throws an
error - such as an auth error from keystone - that error response
must still have CORS headers in order to be readable by the
user agent.

openstack-config-generator hooks were not added in this patch, as
it does not appear that designate explicitly supports them.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html

Change-Id: Ib66e8afafbde568549228c98d210f02466a90cc8

", 'number': 8}, {'created': '2015-10-08 14:22:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add semantic title for keystone_tenant.

This is a WIP to add this feature to keystone_tenant:

  keystone_tenant { 'project_one::domain_one': ensure => present }
  keystone_tenant { 'project_one::domain_two': ensure => present }

while still keeping this syntax:

  keystone_tenant { 'meaningless_title_one':
    name   => 'project_less',
    domain => 'domain_one'
  }

This patch still allow one to define a tenant like this:

  keystone_tenant { 'project_name': ensure => present }

This will attach 'project_name' to the default domain.

Change-Id: I4deb27dc6f71fb7a7ec6a9c72bd0e1412c2e9a30
", 'number': 13}, {'created': '2015-10-12 11:16:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add composite namevar for tenant, user, user_role.

There are two sides on this patch, the user facing one, and the
developer's one.

It gives more flexibility for the interface used by the user for the
Keystone_tenant, Keystone_user and Keystone_user_roles resources.  For
instance to specify a user and give the admin role, currently you have
to:

  keystone_user { 'new_admin::admin_domain':
    ensure      => present,
    enabled     => true,
    tenant      => 'openstackv3::admin_domain',
    email       => 'test@example.tld',
    password    => 'a_big_secret',
  }
  keystone_user_role { 'new_admin::admin_domain@openstackv3::admin_domain':
    ensure         => present,
    roles          => ['admin'],
  }

Now you can specify it like this:

  keystone_user { 'new_admin':
    ensure      => present,
    enabled     => true,
    domain      => 'admin_domain',
    tenant      => 'openstackv3::admin_domain',
    email       => 'test@example.tld',
    password    => 'a_big_secret',
  }
  keystone_user_role { 'new_admin@openstackv3':
    ensure         => present,
    user_domain    => 'admin_domain',
    project_domain => 'admin_domain',
    roles          => ['admin'],
  }

For the developer this simplify the code.  Puppet is using composite
namevar to make all the resources unique.  So guessing what pattern is
used in the title is no longer required.  For instance this :

  keystone_tenant { 'project_one': ensure => present }
  keystone_tenant { 'meaningless': name => 'project_one', domain => 'Default', ensure => present }

is detected as the same tenant by puppet.

The same is true for dependencies. This is working correctly:

keystone_tenant { 'meaningless': name => 'project_one', domain => 'domain_one', ensure => present }
file {'/tmp/toto': ensure => present, require => Keystone_tenant['project_one::domain_one'] }

Change-Id: I4deb27dc6f71fb7a7ec6a9c72bd0e1412c2e9a30

  keystone_tenant { 'meaningless': name => 'project_one', domain => 'Default', ensure => present }

is detected as the same tenant by puppet.

The same is true for dependencies. This is working correctly:

file {'/tmp/toto': ensure => present, require => Keystone_tenant['project_one::domain_one'] }

", 'number': 24}, {'created': '2015-10-13 14:59:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add composite namevar for tenant, user, user_role.

There are two sides on this patch, the user facing one, and the
developer's one.

It gives more flexibility for the interface used by the user for the
Keystone_tenant, Keystone_user and Keystone_user_roles resources.  For
instance to specify a user and give the admin role, currently you have
to:

  keystone_user { 'new_admin::admin_domain':
    ensure      => present,
    enabled     => true,
    tenant      => 'openstackv3::admin_domain',
    email       => 'test@example.tld',
    password    => 'a_big_secret',
  }
  keystone_user_role { 'new_admin::admin_domain@openstackv3::admin_domain':
    ensure         => present,
    roles          => ['admin'],
  }

Now you can specify it like this:

  keystone_user { 'new_admin':
    ensure      => present,
    enabled     => true,
    domain      => 'admin_domain',
    tenant      => 'openstackv3::admin_domain',
    email       => 'test@example.tld',
    password    => 'a_big_secret',
  }
  keystone_user_role { 'new_admin@openstackv3':
    ensure         => present,
    user_domain    => 'admin_domain',
    project_domain => 'admin_domain',
    roles          => ['admin'],
  }

For the developer this simplify the code.  Puppet is using composite
namevar to make all the resources unique.  So guessing what pattern is
used in the title is no longer required.  For instance this :

  keystone_tenant { 'project_one': ensure => present }
  keystone_tenant { 'meaningless': name => 'project_one', domain => 'Default', ensure => present }

is detected as the same tenant by puppet.

The same is true for dependencies. This is working correctly:

keystone_tenant { 'meaningless': name => 'project_one', domain => 'domain_one', ensure => present }
file {'/tmp/toto': ensure => present, require => Keystone_tenant['project_one::domain_one'] }

    roles          => ['admin'],
  }

Now you can specify it like this:

  keystone_user { 'new_admin':
    ensure      => present,
    enabled     => true,
    domain      => 'admin_domain',
    tenant      => 'openstackv3::admin_domain',
    email       => 'test@example.tld',
    password    => 'a_big_secret',
  }
  keystone_user_role { 'new_admin@openstackv3':
    ensure         => present,
    user_domain    => 'admin_domain',
    project_domain => 'admin_domain',
    roles          => ['admin'],
  }

For the developer this simplify the code.  Puppet is using composite
namevar to make all the resources unique.  So guessing what pattern is
used in the title is no longer required.  For instance this :

  keystone_tenant { 'project_one': ensure => present }
  keystone_tenant { 'meaningless': name => 'project_one', domain => 'Default', ensure => present }

is detected as the same tenant by puppet.

The same is true for dependencies. This is working correctly:

  keystone_tenant { 'meaningless': name => 'project_one', domain => 'domain_one', ensure => present }
  file {'/tmp/needed': ensure => present, require => Keystone_tenant['project_one::domain_one'] }

In autorequire term in type definition, you just have to pass the fully
qualified name (with the domain suffix for user and tenant) of the
resource and puppet will do the matching, whatever the original title
is.  See the examples in user and tenant in keystone_user_role type.
