developer's one.

It gives more flexibility for the interface used by the user for the
Keystone_tenant, Keystone_user and Keystone_user_roles resources.  For
instance to specify a user and give the admin role, currently you have
to:

  keystone_user { 'new_admin::admin_domain':
    ensure      => present,
    enabled     => true,
    tenant      => 'openstackv3::admin_domain',
    email       => 'test@example.tld',
    password    => 'a_big_secret',
  }
  keystone_user_role { 'new_admin::admin_domain@openstackv3::admin_domain':
    ensure         => present,
    roles          => ['admin'],
  }

Now you can specify it like this:

  keystone_user { 'new_admin':
    ensure      => present,
    enabled     => true,
    domain      => 'admin_domain',
    tenant      => 'openstackv3::admin_domain',
    email       => 'test@example.tld',
    password    => 'a_big_secret',
  }
  keystone_user_role { 'new_admin@openstackv3':
    ensure         => present,
    user_domain    => 'admin_domain',
    project_domain => 'admin_domain',
    roles          => ['admin'],
  }

For the developer this simplify the code.  Puppet is using composite
namevar to make all the resources unique.  So guessing what pattern is
used in the title is no longer required.  For instance this :

  keystone_tenant { 'project_one': ensure => present }
  keystone_tenant { 'meaningless': name => 'project_one', domain => 'Default', ensure => present }

is detected as the same tenant by puppet.

The same is true for dependencies. This is working correctly:

  keystone_tenant { 'meaningless': name => 'project_one', domain => 'domain_one', ensure => present }
  file {'/tmp/needed': ensure => present, require => Keystone_tenant['project_one::domain_one'] }

In autorequire term in type definition, you just have to pass the fully
qualified name (with the domain suffix for user and tenant) of the
resource and puppet will do the matching, whatever the original title
is.  See the examples in user and tenant in keystone_user_role type.

commit_message:
Add composite namevar for tenant, user, user_role.

There are two sides on this patch, the user facing one, and the
developer's one.

It gives more flexibility for the interface used by the user for the
Keystone_tenant, Keystone_user and Keystone_user_roles resources.  For
instance to specify a user and give the admin role, currently you have
to:

  keystone_user { 'new_admin::admin_domain':
    ensure      => present,
    enabled     => true,
    tenant      => 'openstackv3::admin_domain',
    email       => 'test@example.tld',
    password    => 'a_big_secret',
  }
  keystone_user_role { 'new_admin::admin_domain@openstackv3::admin_domain':
    ensure         => present,
    roles          => ['admin'],
  }

Now you can specify it like this:

  keystone_user { 'new_admin':
    ensure      => present,
    enabled     => true,
    domain      => 'admin_domain',
    tenant      => 'openstackv3::admin_domain',
    email       => 'test@example.tld',
    password    => 'a_big_secret',
  }
  keystone_user_role { 'new_admin@openstackv3':
    ensure         => present,
    user_domain    => 'admin_domain',
    project_domain => 'admin_domain',
    roles          => ['admin'],
  }

For the developer this simplify the code.  Puppet is using composite
namevar to make all the resources unique.  So guessing what pattern is
used in the title is no longer required.  For instance this :

  keystone_tenant { 'project_one': ensure => present }
  keystone_tenant { 'meaningless': name => 'project_one', domain => 'Default', ensure => present }

is detected as the same tenant by puppet.

The same is true for dependencies. This is working correctly:

  keystone_tenant { 'meaningless': name => 'project_one', domain => 'domain_one', ensure => present }
  file {'/tmp/needed': ensure => present, require => Keystone_tenant['project_one::domain_one'] }

In autorequire term in type definition, you just have to pass the fully
qualified name (with the domain suffix for user and tenant) of the
resource and puppet will do the matching, whatever the original title
is.  See the examples in user and tenant in keystone_user_role type.

Change-Id: I4deb27dc6f71fb7a7ec6a9c72bd0e1412c2e9a30

', 'number': 7}, {'created': '2015-05-13 16:15:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'support for keystone v3 api - the endpoint resource

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support
This patch implements these parts of the blueprint:
1) Implements support for the keystone_endpoint resource using
the v3 api.  With v3, endpoint create does not take all 3 of the
admin, internal, and public endpoints.  Instead, it takes 1 at a
time.  This implementation will call endpoint create and endpoint
delete 3 times to create or delete all 3 endpoints with 1 call
to the keystone_endpoint resource in manifests, in order not to
break the existing manifest API.  For modify/set, it will use
the ID of each endpoint.  It keeps the 3 IDs in a comma
delimited list.

Change-Id: I8c21b21803805919ae7981ffef74c5e205afe1c1
Co-Authored-By: Gilles Dubreuil <gilles@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emacchi@redhat.com>
', 'number': 8}, {'created': '2015-05-13 19:44:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'support for keystone v3 api - the endpoint resource

commit_message:
keystone_endpoint provider for Keystone v3 api

In keystone v3 there is one endpoint per 'interface' (url).
To offer backward compatibility this provider creates a 'virtual' endpoint by
combining the 3 URLs (admin, internal, private) using their 3 IDs in a comma
delimited list.

Implements: blueprint api-v3-support
Change-Id: I8c21b21803805919ae7981ffef74c5e205afe1c1

commit_message:
Add support for Xen PV disks

Xen paravirtualised disks (supported by most modern kernels) have the
"xvd" prefix (e.g. xvda0).  The functions to strip partitions need to
match on Xen PV disks otherwise the device name is discarded.

Change-Id: I5539d2afba3fae30d1ddb49dcbf077113d38bbf7
Closes-Bug: #1498576

', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-10-02 16:57:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Delete fipnamespace when external net removed on DVR

The fipnamespace is associated with an external network
on a given node. In the case of DVR there is just one
single FIP namespace for a given node. 

We have seen some race conditions in the agent for creation
and deletion of the fip namespace. See the bug report for
details on the failure.

So in order to address this race condition and make the
code more stable, we will be cleaning up the fip namespace
only when an external network is removed.

The server will be sending a rpc notification message to 
the agent to cleanup the fip namespace when the external
net is removed.

This patch address the above mentioned issue by not constantly
deleting and creating the fip namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1501873
Change-Id: I86869f66d4afffad7db09942578b1a456a9bd418

on a given node. In the case of DVR there is just one
single FIP namespace for a given node.

We have seen some race conditions in the agent for creation
and deletion of the fip namespace. See the bug report for
details on the failure.

So in order to address this race condition and make the
code more stable, we will be cleaning up the fip namespace
only when an external network is removed.

The server will be sending a rpc notification message to
the agent to cleanup the fip namespace when the external
net is removed.

This patch address the above mentioned issue by not constantly
deleting and creating the fip namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1501873
Change-Id: I86869f66d4afffad7db09942578b1a456a9bd418

commit_message:
Delete fipnamespace when external net removed on DVR

The fipnamespace is associated with an external network
on a given node. In the case of DVR there is just one
single FIP namespace for a given node.

We have seen some race conditions in the agent for creation
and deletion of the fip namespace. See the bug report for
details on the failure.

So in order to address this race condition and make the
code more stable, we will be cleaning up the fip namespace
only when an external network is removed.

The server will be sending a rpc notification message to
the agent to cleanup the fip namespace when the external
net is removed.

This patch address the above mentioned issue by not constantly
deleting and creating the fip namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1501873
Change-Id: I86869f66d4afffad7db09942578b1a456a9bd418

commit_message:
Load the validation-scripts as role extra data for tuskar init

Adds the newly introduced 'validation-scripts' directory to the
list of paths from which extra data is included at role file
loading time.

Depends on the relevant tripleo-heat-templates change at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/204781/

Change-Id: I0fe4fde44cf1b9eb1aaa198e331721e022f8f7cb
Depends-On: I63cf95b27e8ad2aed48718cf84df5f324780e597

Fix missing images

On my previous commits I forgot to include the newly created task
'images' as part of the production task.

Change-Id: I0ad63356e2bf16ff2794333216a2c0b4f5b16089

subject: add pip cache warming to non dib builder
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-04 18:24:18.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/scripts/pip-warm-cache.sh', 'nodepool/scripts/prepare_devstack.sh'], 'message': "add pip cache warming to non dib builder

We also need to warm the cache where we don't use disk image builder,
this copies the method to the old way of doing things as well. It's a
bit denormalized because it's not entirely clear if there is access to
all the elements when run in this mode.

Change-Id: Ie07d0fb7946a066a37c3d29c29a6e7e4d247399f
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
add pip cache warming to non dib builder

We also need to warm the cache where we don't use disk image builder,
this copies the method to the old way of doing things as well. It's a
bit denormalized because it's not entirely clear if there is access to
all the elements when run in this mode.

Change-Id: Ie07d0fb7946a066a37c3d29c29a6e7e4d247399f

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-14 14:33:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Correct ironic auth settings

The existing ironic.conf uses an unversioned keystone auth_url
setting. As the keystone API now defaults to v3 this can
cause provisioning failures if Ironic needs to communicate
with other services (neutron). This is because we haven't yet
updated TripleO to properly support configuration with
keystone V3.

Change-Id: Ief7fc3dbbd8b8c33ea3ec7bd127231698af27a7f
Depends-On: Ideefb4d824cbd5b4b83f9eb773a75e536e3458fb
Closes-bug: #1495090

cause provisioning failures if Ironic needs to communicate

Change-Id: Ief7fc3dbbd8b8c33ea3ec7bd127231698af27a7f", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-10-21 20:34:53.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': "Correct ironic auth settings

The existing ironic.conf uses an unversioned keystone auth_url
setting. As the keystone API now defaults to v3 this can
cause provisioning failures if Ironic needs to communicate
with other services (neutron). This is because we haven't yet
updated TripleO to properly support configuration with
keystone V3.

if we don't puppet-ironic will use the auth_protocol and
auth_host parameters to construct it incorrectly if
we don't (since we no longer set those parameters).

Change-Id: Ief7fc3dbbd8b8c33ea3ec7bd127231698af27a7f

commit_message:
Correct ironic auth settings

The existing ironic.conf uses an unversioned keystone auth_url
setting. As the keystone API now defaults to v3 this can
cause provisioning failures if Ironic needs to communicate
with other services (neutron). This is because we haven't yet
updated TripleO to properly support configuration with
keystone V3.

We also need to set the ironic neutron_url because
if we don't puppet-ironic will use the auth_protocol and
auth_host parameters to construct it incorrectly if
we don't (since we no longer set those parameters).

Change-Id: Ief7fc3dbbd8b8c33ea3ec7bd127231698af27a7f
Depends-On: Ibcc63d82b6e7b9de6ef12209a43f39a4cdecb5a2
Closes-bug: #1495090

commit_message:
Add virt-driver CPU thread pinning

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/virt-driver-cpu-pinning

Resubmit the thread policy aspect of the 'virt-driver-cpu-pinning'
spec, which was not implemented in Kilo.

This is a reproposal of a spec approved for Liberty. However, it
includes new naming for one of the four policies.

Change-Id: I4f75c7182a04903bd89aced654338d0fd2f2ba4d
Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning
Previously-Approved: Liberty

commit_message:
Use assertTrue/False instead of assertEqual(T/F)

Usage of assertEqual(True/False, ***) should be changed to a more
meaningful format of assertTrue/False(***).

Change-Id: I8623f5534f00ea1690f74a297488957a8d35f074
Closes-Bug: #1510001

* Manifest for evaluator and auth
* acceptance
* example
* unit tests
* Fix dbsync command and run it to make evaluator work

commit_message:
Add default stable/liberty branch to .gitreview

This patch adds the defaultbranch tag to the .gitreview file for
stable/liberty to ensure that any reviews done from this branch end up
in the right place on gerrit.

Change-Id: I55db3f427b35cdc8e27a0fd45c5b6960f8becd97

Support jinja2 in rally.ui.utils

Use pkgutil to get base templates path.
Move ci templates to rally.ui package.
Remove cli functionality and use rally.ui directly in CI code.

Add standard status footer

One of the requests we got during Summit was to make OpenStack Health
look more like other status pages. This commit includes the status
footer.

commit_message:
Add standard status header

One of the requests we got during Summit was to make OpenStack Health
look more like other status pages. This commit includes the status
header.

Change-Id: Id96ee1688e66445c3b42222bad088211f4e19437

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-29 01:14:34.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/volume-api/src/v2/os-volume-manage-v2.wadl', 'api-ref/src/wadls/volume-api/src/v2/os-vol-image-meta-v2.wadl', 'api-ref/src/wadls/volume-api/src/v2/volume-api-v2.wadl', 'api-ref/src/wadls/volume-api/src/v2/common.ent'], 'message': 'Provide the correct Cinder volume unit size

Both Horizon and the cinder client documents the size paramater in
gigabyes(GB) but the API docs(both v1 and v2) list the size units as
gibibytes(GiB). The correct unit should be gigabytes(GB).

Change-Id: I4613e40d7aa2eb53c5718b0bbce693ef30951ec6
Closes-Bug: 1511167
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Provide the correct Cinder volume unit size

Both Horizon and the cinder client documents the size paramater in
gigabyes(GB) but the API docs(both v1 and v2) list the size units as
gibibytes(GiB). The correct unit should be gigabytes(GB).

Change-Id: I4613e40d7aa2eb53c5718b0bbce693ef30951ec6
Closes-Bug: 1511167

commit_message:
Deprecate create_tenant and tenant_name

As of Liberty, tenant_name was deprecated in favor of project_name.

:create_tenant is also being deprecated in favor of :create_project

Change-Id: I347abf1c004ea78f85024114407c8820e40c3ee7
Depends-On: I4240e875f0495c0b484b1740f08ac037528a78aa
Partial-Bug: #1512480

subject: Use _assert_has_(no)_errors() in hacking tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-03 19:22:19.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/unit/test_hacking.py'], 'message': 'Use _assert_has_(no)_errors() in hacking tests

_assert_has_errors() and _assert_has_no_errors() us much easier to read
and understand. This change switches over the tests to use those fixture
methods.

Change-Id: I4aa8f973d1be34739a7fb2edcf85a956b2cf7859
Closes-Bug: #1512802

commit_message:
Use _assert_has_(no)_errors() in hacking tests

_assert_has_errors() and _assert_has_no_errors() us much easier to read
and understand. This change switches over the tests to use those fixture
methods.

Change-Id: I4aa8f973d1be34739a7fb2edcf85a956b2cf7859
Closes-Bug: #1512802

subject: Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-22 16:48:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: Id33c964252cbd1fa1e1b2d06ae946da7fca9bcf5

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

It also stop testing nova::rabbitmq which is something we don't want
to support anymore. It's included in this commit otherwise unit tests
will fail.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Depends-On: Ifa4026fb9407cd7f43685c89ac69e60588783915
Change-Id: Id33c964252cbd1fa1e1b2d06ae946da7fca9bcf5

commit_message:
Normalize int config values to string

We have no things that expect actual int values. It's easy to write
ints in yaml though - so normalize them to strings.

Change-Id: I58cfdda697da9b7e030f4165ef8e60f4e9d00b66

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-01 21:55:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'VPNaaS: Multiple Local Subnets

WIP: As the migration sync functional test is failing (but manual
check of migration is working). I'm not sure I have that piece right.

Implements support for multiple local subnets for IPSec site to site
connections, using the new Endpoint Group API.

The implementation supports backwards compatibility as follows. If
a VPN service is created with a subnet, then the older API is assumed
and the user must specify the peer CIDRs for any IPSec connections
and cannot specify multiple local subnets.

If a subnet is not provided for the VPN service, then the user must
use the newer API and provide a local and peer endpoint group IDs for
the IPSec connection (and cannot specify the peer CIDRs in the IPSec
connection API).

Implication here is that the subnet will be an optional argument for
the VPN service API.

With this feature, when an endpoint group is deleted, a check is made
to ensure that there are no IPSec connections using the group.

Migration will move the subnet from VPN service API to a new endpoint
group, and specify the group in any connections using the service.
The peer CIDR(s) will be moved from each connection to an endpoint
group, with the group ID specified in the connection.

Note: As part of testing the database methods for this feature, several
more tests were created to test database access only, instead of doing
a round trip test. In a separate commit, these tests can be expanded,
and the existing round trip tests removed.

Note: Tests for building the dict used in sync requests was enhanced,
as part of supporting this feature. The previous tests didn't check
that the peer CIDR information was correct, so were enhanced as well.

Note: The service driver passes the local CIDR(s) in a new field,
called local_cidrs. This field is used for the older API, as well,
passing the subnet's CIDR, and allowing consistent consumption by the
device driver. The IP version is also passed, rather than obtaining
it from the subnet info (so both new and old API use the same fields).

Note: In the device driver, I noticed that the local CIDR's IP version
can change the config file output, so I added test cases for IPv6, as
part of enhancing the tests for multiple local CIDRs.

Note: The user could change the CIDR of a subnet that is used by a
local endpoint group. A separate commit (for Neutron) is needed to
be able to get a notification of that event. We could either force
a "sync" as a result of the change, or block the change with an in-
use exception. A decision on method will be needed for that commit.

Just for reference, these other actions are needed for this feature,
and will be done under separate commits:

- Neutron client support for API changes.
- Functional test (scenario) with new feature.
- API test for new APIs (once API tests available in repo).
- API documentation for endpoint groups and multiple subnets.
- Horizon support for feature.
- Check when changing subnet in use by endpoint group (see Note).

Change-Id: I7a011e3170d7db463a6561e550b2ead3e3311125
Partial-Bug: 1459423

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-10-07 20:53:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "VPNaaS: Multiple Local Subnets feature

Implements support for multiple local subnets for IPSec site to site
connections, using the new Endpoint Group API.

The implementation supports backwards compatibility as follows. If
a VPN service is created with a subnet, then the older API is assumed
and the user must specify the peer CIDRs for any IPSec connections
and cannot specify multiple local subnets.

If a subnet is not provided for the VPN service, then the user must
use the newer API and provide a local and peer endpoint group IDs for
the IPSec connection (and cannot specify the peer CIDRs in the IPSec
connection API).

Implication here is that the subnet will be an optional argument for
the VPN service API.

With this feature, when an endpoint group is deleted, a check is made
to ensure that there are no IPSec connections using the group.

Migration will move the subnet from VPN service API to a new endpoint
group, and specify the group in any connections using the service.
The peer CIDR(s) will be moved from each connection to an endpoint
group, with the group ID specified in the connection.

Note: As part of testing the database methods for this feature, several
more tests were created to test database access only, instead of doing
a round trip test. In a separate commit, these tests can be expanded,
and the existing round trip tests removed.

Note: Tests for building the dict used in sync requests was enhanced,
as part of supporting this feature. The previous tests didn't check
that the peer CIDR information was correct, so were enhanced as well.

Note: The service driver passes the local CIDR(s) in a new field,
called local_cidrs. This field is used for the older API, as well,
passing the subnet's CIDR, and allowing consistent consumption by the
device driver. The IP version is also passed, rather than obtaining
it from the subnet info (so both new and old API use the same fields).

Note: In the device driver, I noticed that the local CIDR's IP version
can change the config file output, so I added test cases for IPv6, as
part of enhancing the tests for multiple local CIDRs.

Note: Created enhancement bug to improve checking, when a subnet's
CIDR is changed, and the subnet is used by VPN service or Endpoint
Group. This will require a neutron change, as well as a VPN change.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1503862

Just for reference, these other actions are needed for this feature,
and will be done under separate commits:

- Neutron client support for API changes (review 231133).
- Functional test (scenario) with new feature.
- API test for new APIs (once API tests available in repo).
- API documentation for endpoint groups and multiple subnets.
- Horizon support for feature.
- Check when changing subnet in use by endpoint group (see Note).

Change-Id: I7a011e3170d7db463a6561e550b2ead3e3311125
Partial-Bug: 1459423

commit_message:
VPNaaS: Multiple Local Subnets feature

Implements support for multiple local subnets for IPSec site to site
connections, using the new Endpoint Group API.

The implementation supports backwards compatibility as follows. If
a VPN service is created with a subnet, then the older API is assumed
and the user must specify the peer CIDRs for any IPSec connections
and cannot specify multiple local subnets.

If a subnet is not provided for the VPN service, then the user must
use the newer API and provide a local and peer endpoint group IDs for
the IPSec connection (and cannot specify the peer CIDRs in the IPSec
connection API).

Implication here is that the subnet will be an optional argument for
the VPN service API.

With this feature, when an endpoint group is deleted, a check is made
to ensure that there are no IPSec connections using the group.

Migration will move the subnet from VPN service API to a new endpoint
group, and specify the group in any connections using the service.
The peer CIDR(s) will be moved from each connection to an endpoint
group, with the group ID specified in the connection.

Note: As part of testing the database methods for this feature, several
more tests were created to test database access only, instead of doing
a round trip test. In a separate commit, these tests can be expanded,
and the existing round trip tests removed.

Note: Tests for building the dict used in sync requests was enhanced,
as part of supporting this feature. The previous tests didn't check
that the peer CIDR information was correct, so were enhanced as well.

Note: The service driver passes the local CIDR(s) in a new field,
called local_cidrs. This field is used for the older API, as well,
passing the subnet's CIDR, and allowing consistent consumption by the
device driver. The IP version is also passed, rather than obtaining
it from the subnet info (so both new and old API use the same fields).

Note: to support rolling upgrades, where an agent may be using the older
release, after the server has been updated, the subnet CIDR field passed
from the service driver to device driver, will be populated from the
first local endpoint from the first connection (there has to be at least
one connection, when sending data to the agent).

Note: In the device driver, I noticed that the local CIDR's IP version
can change the config file output, so I added test cases for IPv6, as
part of enhancing the tests for multiple local CIDRs.

Change-Id: I7a011e3170d7db463a6561e550b2ead3e3311125
Partial-Bug: 1459423

commit_message:
Fix infinite spinner for Angular panels

Allow Angular panels to refresh when URI and the
link location is the same.

The solution is based off comments at

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16002984/angularjs-how-can-i-do-a-redirect-with-a-full-page-load

Closes Bug: #1506211

Change-Id: Icb4f3fba8386eea90c782db65e8b3a62f649a1e8

commit_message:
Don't hide Karma coverage reports

This patch updates the file names of the coverage reports so they are
visible by default on most systems. Also updates the .gitignore, so the
new files are not pushed to the Horizon repo.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: 1508526
Change-Id: I3c1c8f4c88819e2f49b60722ea8cc37bdc711b8c

commit_message:
Updated(into the Github repository) the added  filter to secret list for acl secrets.

In the previous commit the author added a neat feature to allow users
to get a list of secrets for which they are on the ACL.
This has been updated to the respective places.

Change-Id: Ic05400e5b81daacb47d6ceadadd99283b581037e
Closes-Bug: #1499324

commit_message:
Add unit tests around HomeController

As part of building a reliable UI, I am including tests around our
core components.

There is a minor change made to HomeController: instead of getting the
current date as part of the loading process, the date is injected once
the controller is loaded. That helps us testing the controller behavior.

Change-Id: Id19bc9e212329990a415077f53924321ce737bed

subject: Support OFFLINE mode
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-04 02:42:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Support OFFLINE mode

Previously, if the devstack user set OFFLINE=True in local.conf,
networking-ovn would ignore this and try to clone OVS from git,
which would fail if the repository wasn't already there. This
commit fixes this so if OFFLINE=True is set in local.conf, we
verify this before trying to clone OVS, and die if the OVS git
repository is not there when in OFFLINE mode.

Change-Id: Ie5439128107a42306b25be5dc5de2517977859e7
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-04 16:17:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Support OFFLINE mode

This patch makes use of the "git_clone" function, which handles
OFFLINE=True implicitly.

Change-Id: Ie5439128107a42306b25be5dc5de2517977859e7
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-11-04 17:11:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Support OFFLINE mode

This patch makes use of the "git_clone" function, which handles
OFFLINE=True implicitly.

Change-Id: Ie5439128107a42306b25be5dc5de2517977859e7

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-11-04 17:15:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Support OFFLINE mode

This patch makes use of the "git_clone" function, which handles
OFFLINE=True implicitly.

Change-Id: Ie5439128107a42306b25be5dc5de2517977859e7
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>
', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-11-04 17:55:08.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Support OFFLINE mode

This patch makes use of the "git_clone" function, which handles
OFFLINE=True implicitly.

Change-Id: Ie5439128107a42306b25be5dc5de2517977859e7
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>
', 'number': 5}]
commit_message:
Support OFFLINE mode

This patch makes use of the "git_clone" function, which handles
OFFLINE=True implicitly.

Change-Id: Ie5439128107a42306b25be5dc5de2517977859e7
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

commit_message:
warm pip wheel cache during image build

This installs everything in upper-constraints in a throw away venv,
which has the knock on effect of fully populating the wheel cache for
root with wheels for everything. This hopefully speeds up all devstack
runs quite a bit.

Change-Id: I429f353c33d892f76552c83d34ac1329ed18f97f

commit_message:
Remove references to router_delete_namespaces option in tests

Deprecated router_delete_namespaces option was removed in neutron
by change I2a879213c3b095a007a4531f430a33cea9fdf1bd and this caused
failures of functional tests.
We should remove all references to this option.

Change-Id: I80cc5bc1037c974a816466f94f354927ba21c726

subject: Fix volume size units to match the API
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-03 23:18:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix volume size units to match the API

Both Horizon and the cinder client documents the size paramater in
gigabyes(GBs) but the API docs(both v1 and v2) list the size units as
gibibytes(GiBs). The correct unit should be gibibytes(GiBs). This
should help in clearing up any confusion on what units are used in
Cinder.

Change-Id: I42e15c18d1f084d435a2be9b343fb2f6c3cf377f
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-03 23:26:12.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v1/shell.py', 'cinderclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': 'Fix volume size units to match the API

Both Horizon and the cinder client documents the size paramater in
gigabyes(GBs) but the API docs(both v1 and v2) list the size units as
gibibytes(GiBs). The correct unit should be gibibytes(GiBs). This
should help in clearing up any confusion on what units are used in
Cinder.

Closes-bug: 1511167
Change-Id: I42e15c18d1f084d435a2be9b343fb2f6c3cf377f
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix volume size units to match the API

Both Horizon and the cinder client documents the size paramater in
gigabyes(GBs) but the API docs(both v1 and v2) list the size units as
gibibytes(GiBs). The correct unit should be gibibytes(GiBs). This
should help in clearing up any confusion on what units are used in
Cinder.

Closes-bug: 1511167
Change-Id: I42e15c18d1f084d435a2be9b343fb2f6c3cf377f

commit_message:
Honor rabbitmq username/password

If a rabbitmq username/password were set in undercloud.conf previously,
they were not honored, and all services would fail to connect to rabbit.
Also cleans up the way we include rabbit in the puppet manifest to bring
it inline with how it's done for the Overcloud.

Change-Id: If851db7edf3e2fc5fbd0722ebf3df6e5b16681a0

commit_message:
Use SEED_IP to decide if we can ssh to the undercloud

And default it to "", this will prevent a "unbound variable"
error, also don't set it until we know we should have ssh
access to the seed.

Change-Id: I4b7ce35cabed3068bd68c7519fbbd1e6e755dba5

subject: Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7156, 'name': 'Mathieu Gagné', 'email': 'mgagne@calavera.ca', 'username': 'mgagne'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 9061, 'name': 'David Moreau Simard', 'email': 'moi@dmsimard.com', 'username': 'dmsimard'}, {'_account_id': 9500, 'name': 'Matt Fischer', 'email': 'matt@mattfischer.com', 'username': 'mfisch'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-22 16:06:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I4b72eef7fd4d4ee7b226a5014b7d180506161f69

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I4b72eef7fd4d4ee7b226a5014b7d180506161f69

subject: clarify the example in 'Simulation with Actions'
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-27 12:31:31.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/enforcement.rst'], 'message': 'clarify the example in 'Simulation with Actions'

In RST document congress/doc/source/enforcement.rst.

The policy 'aliceactions' is created at first in the example,
but that is never used, all the following command use the
default 'action' policy, that make the users confused about
which policy we should create "action('set')" rule into and
which action policy we should use in simulate? Aims to clarify
the usage, avoid to use default 'action' policy, and use
'aliceactions' policy in the example.

Change-Id: I1c976120c20b8e766a6692d3ab16e91f92da8b5c

commit_message:
clarify the example in 'Simulation with Actions'

In RST document congress/doc/source/enforcement.rst.

The policy 'aliceactions' is created at first in the example,
but that is never used, all the following command use the
default 'action' policy, that make the users confused about
which policy we should create "action('set')" rule into and
which action policy we should use in simulate? Aims to clarify
the usage, avoid to use default 'action' policy, and use
'aliceactions' policy in the example.

Change-Id: I1c976120c20b8e766a6692d3ab16e91f92da8b5c
Closes-Bug: #1510428

commit_message:
Fixing bug in injection test

The injection test was broken, it assumed that the call arg in the
context would reflect the type passed into the detected call, this
is not the case. We check the AST node type instead now

Change-Id: Idd7d8ed5ab7062af79b8e77d6df0cc39bddb7663
Closes-bug: 1513091

commit_message:
Mostly revert "Disable tempest"

This reverts commit 78f7de73973d3676185348e3e22963096f1536d1 except for
the deprecation notes in undercloud.conf.sample.
Tempest is now available in delorean.

Change-Id: Ief0cef5c022a8904582eb3c71a537d3cae75fde6

Use RequestSpec object in HostManager

Since now there is a RequestSpec, let's use it for the HostManager.

Partially-Implements: blueprint request-spec-object-mitaka

Change-Id: Ic762c8f1f8a666bcb0e9c5aea9f4022052e89fcf

commit_message:
run_tests: install puppet from puppetlabs.com repo

Use puppetlabs.com repositories to handle Puppet packaging, like it's
done in Beaker jobs.

That way, we will run the latest version available in Puppetlabs
repositories, in a consistent way with beaker jobs.

Depends-On: Iaba6e499b1185d75930f0e7b0ca587e9f8705e5a
Change-Id: I2d49c1e913bbbf243dca3fcf41f592168f46b57b

[{'created': '2015-10-21 00:36:06.000000000', 'files': ['congress/policy_engines/agnostic.py'], 'message': "Sets loaded rule info to Rule instances

Policy Engine initializes Rule instances when Congress starts
if rules are persited in db. The bug is that Policy Engine only
loads persited rule string but doesn't set other infomation,
id, name and comment. This patch lets Policy Engine set the

Change-Id: Id8354d9bff0d5b5938406473e2f344e726bd2f3c
(cherry picked from commit 19dd02831ec995c4bcabc256bac1b0dde5088bb5)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Sets loaded rule info to Rule instances

Policy Engine initializes Rule instances when Congress starts
if rules are persited in db. The bug is that Policy Engine only
loads persited rule string but doesn't set other infomation,
id, name and comment. This patch lets Policy Engine set the
lacked infomations to Rule instance.

Closes-Bug: #1507329

commit_message:
Use oslo_config new type PortOpt for port options

The oslo_config library provides new type PortOpt to validate the
range of port now.

Change-Id: Iecd1e35c9108bb455204d110177b00f622b77a2c
ref: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/2.6.0/oslo_config/cfg.py#L1114
Depends-On: Ida294b05a85f5bef587b761fcd03c28c7a3474d8
Depends-On: Ifce070d8d85ef52524a24359335de235e91812a3

commit_message:
Manage keystone initialization directly in t-h-t manifests

This is the second change of a servies of two, it creates the
user, user_role, service and endpoint for:

  * glance
  * nova
  * neutron
  * cinder
  * horizon
  * swift
  * ceilometer
  * heat

Change-Id: I50e792d98a2ba516ff498c58ad402f463c5f7e76

commit_message:
Add a script to start and monitor children processes

start_processes.py starts processes described in a config file.
start_processes.py will restart processes that die if configured with
restart_delay.

Change-Id: I9d41ddf615627dda9c67bea6f2a59298de17e605

commit_message:
Add availability zone information into nova driver

The user can specify which AZ is used to boot up a vm. Since AZ can be
also used to separate security zones it is very useful to have this
information in Congress in order to monitor if VMs are placed in the
right network and uses the correct volume backend.

For more detail information see [1].

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/telcowg-usecases/blob/master/usecases/sec_segregation.rst

Change-Id: Ie53a0fa0600a20f478791a81e7c750378e91476b

commit_message:
Removing the left over config option

This config option was referring to a validator that was removed in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238345/ it is not needed and was
causing anchor to fail startup.

Change-Id: Ia2ef8765f776a8bcba825674b7a246b83b41dd12

commit_message:
Add tripleo F22 periodic jobs

Run the 3 tripleo jobs daily, these can be used to test the most recent
trunk repository. Once the patch triggered ci jobs have moved to F22 we
can use these to trigger a promotion of trunk repositories used by tripleo.

Change-Id: I32d1d6684c6b13b496d082cbf17f3e71b1977879
Depends-On: Ide20099eb181382b792112cbfb06ef20aa358f9c

commit_message:
Allow overriding values using args in ServicePlugin

Some of the subclasses of ServicePlugin allow overriding the
service_api_url using args. This could be useful for all
plugins so move that code into ServicePlugin.

Also allow overriding of process_names, search_pattern,
overwrite and template_dir.

Remove the code in the ironic and trove plugins that duplicated
this code.

Added a unit test for this code.

Change-Id: Ibd97effa6d5bff0cf621e4bdcbe6f5b781d195f4

subject: Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7156, 'name': 'Mathieu Gagné', 'email': 'mgagne@calavera.ca', 'username': 'mgagne'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 9061, 'name': 'David Moreau Simard', 'email': 'moi@dmsimard.com', 'username': 'dmsimard'}, {'_account_id': 9500, 'name': 'Matt Fischer', 'email': 'matt@mattfischer.com', 'username': 'mfisch'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-22 16:53:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I7763fcb25efbe7ccee16f3cf1d796fcfbe977280
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-23 15:16:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

It also stop testing manila::rabbitmq which is something we don't want
to support anymore. It's included in this commit otherwise unit tests
will fail.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Depends-On: Ifa4026fb9407cd7f43685c89ac69e60588783915
Change-Id: I7763fcb25efbe7ccee16f3cf1d796fcfbe977280

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Also do not test cinder::rabbitmq anymore, due to an issue with
rabbitmq::server class. This class is deprecated for a while and we drop
it in master.

Change-Id: Iadcef8079efb8c94282c5cdefb91bfa3920f3919

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-06 17:36:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Cisco Nexus ML2 MD: Need unique key for server level keys in hieradata

types pattern.  Lack of the .each method support prior to puppet 4.0 is the
problem here.  This template change works around the problem by explicitly
adding the hostname to the hieradata for a server under a nexus switch.

The duplicate server names under different switches is needed for vPC

commit_message:
Cisco Nexus ML2 MD: Need unique key for server level keys in hieradata

Due to a limitation in the puppet version used in RHEL7 there is no simple
way to scope a 2nd level hiera hash key with the create_resources + defined
types pattern.  Lack of the .each method support prior to puppet 4.0 is the
problem here.  This template change works around the problem by explicitly
adding the hostname to the hieradata for a server under a nexus switch.

The duplicate server names under different switches is needed for vPC
config scenarios.

Closes-bug: #1506546
Change-Id: I03b866fb440e968c9f86ae93942b687e7165a065

commit_message:
Check valid option combos in _get_ovn_port_options

This function includes common code for handling port options.  Certain
options don't make sense to combine, so localize getting to those
options to the case where they make sense.

Change-Id: Ia7577df825ebb8781c546caa7c7706537391c6f5
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

subject: Fixing Baseline when a filter is used
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-02 14:32:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fixing Baseline when a filter is used

This current baseline doesn't work if a filter is provided due
to the details mentioned here:
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/bandit/+bug/1512360

This fixes it by implementing the severity and confidence
filtering before baseline filtering.

Additionally, since each formatter used an IF statement to check
severity after getting issues, we've just moved the filtering to
the get_issues call.  If for some reason a formatter wants
to get unfiltered, they can omit the call.

Change-Id: I39c1d826f44a8c0d829fb7017d03dbff25779cba

commit_message:
Fixing Baseline when a filter is used

This current baseline doesn't work if a filter is provided due
to the details mentioned here:
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/bandit/+bug/1512360

This fixes it by implementing the severity and confidence
filtering before baseline filtering.

Additionally, since each formatter used an IF statement to check
severity after getting issues, we've just moved the filtering to
the get_issues call.  If for some reason a formatter wants
to get unfiltered, they can omit the call.

Change-Id: I39c1d826f44a8c0d829fb7017d03dbff25779cba
Closes-Bug: #1512360

commit_message:
Making score sum totals more sane

This commit revamps the score sum system that was currently used
by JSON and TXT formatters.  The new approach is that an
aggregate SEVERITY and CONFIDENCE score is shown.

Previously the sum of all scores was added in a confusing way and
reported separately for each file in JSON metrics.  Text didn't
work at all, if you actually wanted to display them (with -v) it
crashed.

Change-Id: Id0c1f97795c6e1030b7fffcb1481da9c390dc4c1
Closes-Bug: #1512335
Closes-Bug: #1512333

[{'created': '2015-11-04 07:41:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fixing Traceback with Bad File

This commit fixes a bug that was causing a traceback when running
Bandit against a single file with bad syntax.  The total metrics
count dictionary previously had no initial value, so if we had
a problem updating with new ones, we'd end up in a situation where
we never had a valid total count.  This fixes it by initializing
totals to 0 at metrics init time.

commit_message:
Fixing Traceback with Bad File

This commit fixes a bug that was causing a traceback when running
Bandit against a single file with bad syntax.  The total metrics
count dictionary previously had no initial value, so if we had
a problem updating with new ones, we'd end up in a situation where
we never had a valid total count.  This fixes it by initializing
totals to 0 at metrics init time.

Change-Id: Ib7f1f54d0d6a0e9ffbb2cc3fc40b17b0c50ce0ca
Closes-Bug: #1512957
Closes-Bug: #1511431

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-19 21:03:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Added CORS support to Magnum

This adds the CORS support middleware to Manila, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

For magnum, a lambda factory was added to allow passing the config
object into a wrap_app method. This wrapping method then applies
any additional middleware configured for the service. Note that the
CORS middleware must be the first one in the middleware chain, so
that it can annotate all responses - even error responses - generated
by other middleware.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html

Change-Id: I7e6d7e2145e3bf883b8a28071c949e10e5c207e0

method, as the last middleware to be wrapped around the application
instance. Common headers were added, in order to avoid magic
configuration moments where a feature does not function without
an operator having to read code.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html

commit_message:
Added CORS support to Magnum

This adds the CORS support middleware to Magnum, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

For magnum, the CORS middleware was directly added to the setup_app
method, as the last middleware to be wrapped around the application
instance. Common headers were added, in order to avoid magic
configuration moments where a feature does not function without
an operator having to read code.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html
DocImpact

Change-Id: I7e6d7e2145e3bf883b8a28071c949e10e5c207e0
Closes-bug: #1508209

commit_message:
Add new eventlet config option 'url_length_limit'

This is to allow overriding eventlet's default of 8192. That might be needed
when trying to revoke large tokens using the v2 API.

Change-Id: I52e69156fccb3f38c1a9ec17a9e360df9bd64076
Closes-Bug: #1491817

commit_message:
Restrict certain APIs to cloud admin in domain-aware policy

Some of the APIs in the domain-aware policy file are currently
allowed by any "admin" user, when they should really be locked
down to the cloud admin.  Without this, users who are a project
admin will be allowed to do things like manage regions, IdPs,
and other objects that they should not be allowed to touch.

Change-Id: Ifca8bc2fffd2d8c1bf02373d1fadd459a77f836c
Closes-bug: #1381809
(cherry picked from commit fdbad9f530ea4478d96437b021c9b5cc6d338901)

commit_message:
QoS BW limits do not affect network devices

Note that while you can assign a QoS policy to a network devices, QoS
bandwidth limits do not affect the ports of network devices.

Change-Id: I2b021f59e096f178596a1ed8ca1286485899d610
Closes-bug: #1496613

That job aims to verify that Tempest tests can run

services are compatible with the Identity API v3.

In addition, there are two job templates for

using the Identity API v3 that have the same goal.

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make Identity API v3 only job default

There is an experimental gate job for Identity API
v3 only for DevStack and Tempest repositories,
where the Identity v2 API is disabled.

That job aims to verify that Tempest tests can run
with the described configuration, and consequently
services are compatible with the Identity API v3.

In addition, there are two job templates for
running Tempest tests (named *keystonev3-full)
using the Identity API v3 that have the same goal.

Now that the Identity API v3 only job is passing
(see change #213430 as an example), the other two
jobs can be removed in favor of it.

Change-Id: Ie596494df384de024ddeaadbd641f4b93dce30e0

commit_message:
Run only volume related tests in tempest-dsvm-full-bdd job

Set TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY=1 for tempest-dsvm-full-bdd job

We've got a limited loopback devices so we can't run this
job with concurrency.

Also to decrease job execution time this patch set
DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX="volume" variable.

Change-Id: Ie79acbd453f52d2dd8736ac69cce6fdde7c63071

commit_message:
Mark arguments for 'credential' commands as required

According to the [1], 'user_id', 'type', and 'blob' are all required
arguments for 'credential set' but the code treats them as optional. Set the
'required' flag and remove logic supporting missing arguments.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/keystone-specs/blob/master/api/v3/identity-api-v3.rst#credentials-v3credentials "spec"

Change-Id: I597c9616ad744385fc6dd92379feb03daec54458
Closes-Bug: #1418837

commit_message:
Remove lbaas v1 job from neutron, remove v2 from neutron gate

- Lbaas v1 is now deprecated, so we get enough coverage in the project repo.
- Neutron does not need to gate on v2, check queue is good enough.

Change-Id: Ib99704c22939ecd935fa770c0f1af21682229ea1

subject: SQL: Fix event-list with multiple trait query filters
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-30 16:10:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'SQL: Fix event-list with multiple trait query filters

When querying events with two different *request_id* trait filters, we
expect the response body is an empty, but it may be not. That is because
the multiple trait query filters are not combined correctly.

commit_message:
SQL: Fix event-list with multiple trait query filters

When querying events with two different *request_id* trait filters, we
expect the response body is an empty, but it may be not. That is because
the multiple trait query filters are not combined correctly.

Change-Id: Id034b01cff891e928625bb0fa668c1ebd7dcf742
Closes-Bug: #1489062
(cherry picked from commit bebfe64575cbede4798b7b5f0c5ef39b725f5092)

commit_message:
puppet/integration: run puppet macro before

To make sure the nodes are clean of packages we want to drop (ie: puppet),
we need to run the macro like it's done for other jobs (beaker).

Change-Id: I744d256c8a54e070f9c091358d035d5e432c0584

commit_message:
Fixes for cinder backup

1) cinder was using cindernative_vol_id instead of cinder_vol_id
2) cinder client has default endpoint 'publicURL' and should be respected if no new endpoint was provided
3) cinder restore had wrong order of arguments in restore_cinder and restore_cinder_by_glance
4) cinder upload_to_image returns response tuple instead of image, now extracts id from tuple and gets image
5) glance data length sometimes 0, changed to get size from glance.images.get
6) fix validator to allow restore and backup cinder and cinder_native without any path

Change-Id: I37126ddd576374ec5a102f8bc68187af3ad01ca2

commit_message:
Create openstack/puppet-openstack-release-tools

We're currently using some scripts (Python, bash) that are located to
different gist or github places.

For consistency and to help Puppet OpenStack release process, we need a
repository where we could host our tools that will be used for release
management.

Change-Id: Ib8087494c366aac8e70b045c47c0f74dc3e186fd

commit_message:
Add/Remove the volume BDMs during resize

During resize instance migrate_disk_and_power_off should release
the existing volumes connected to the instance. Volume BDMS should
be disconnected and re-connected during finish_migrations. This is
required because manager terminates the prev volumes and
re-initializes the volumes again, which can lead to a new SCSI ID.

Change-Id: I9af2b16259dd98332c135b1870386c827d3c56d7
Closes-Bug: #1510235
(cherry picked from commit 49fca0baa73b63fed67b50ff58bb15c21105f6ca)

commit_message:
Don't wrap wrapped exception in create_server

If we've wrapped the exception because of Auth things, we don't need
to re-wrap it - it's just confusing.

Change-Id: Ia1e45f4971f4b51f28538260d64f778aecaa6f3d

commit_message:
Skip an extra unneeded server get

When we're attaching a floating ip, the wait loop gets the most up to
date server dict as part of waiting. In that case, there is no need to
do an additional get. If we're NOT waiting, it's also pointless to do
a single get, as it's not guaranteed to have the updated info.

Change-Id: I84bc54ce32a7d5bf10078027fdb29fab5e84bd39

commit_message:
Add new context manager for shade exceptions

Shade has developed a common pattern within many of the API
methods where we try to avoid re-wrapping OpenStackClientException
exceptions by catching them and simply re-raising. We can eliminate
this duplicate exception handling with a context manager.

Change-Id: Ic39b6e3efc33b7a30f298a3daca6d6c16ab4ca89

commit_message:
Remove log_helper in list_cnas

The list_cnas() method is logging via the pypowervm log_helper
each time a VM is not found. This can generate a lot of
unnecessary logging.  This change removes the logger for
this method only as it's just listing the CNAs for the VM.

Change-Id: Id2f5c114838da293ec2ed3ae38a65c72633f57f6

commit_message:
Use default Keystone API version in Devstack

Right now devstack plugin has old workaround for python-manilaclient
that sets usage of Keystone v2 API for Manila requests.
So, remove it as it is not needed anymore since
python-manilaclient release 1.5.0 that supports Keystone API v3.

Change-Id: I42ce87ed6414b9048e49e24e5368a3f78c79acc5

commit_message:
Remove checks for ipv6 utilities before use

Cirros v0.3.4 is compiled with ipv6 enabled in Busybox,
so utilities like ping6 are now present in the image.

Change-Id: Ic938a970d8f229ef0e3f4c579156e96fee158b8c

commit_message:
Remove the jointly loaded model in finish_volume_migration

After a successful volume migration, the source volume and the
destination volume need to swap the data in the models in
finish_volume_migration. It is sufficient to load the volume
model only and there is no need to load other models, like
volume type, metadata, consistency group, etc. If we load
these additional models, it will lead to NULL key error, when
either source or destination model has a NULL key pointer.

Change-Id: I04ad0739387d602719591680854e6655cc87f9ab
Closes-Bug: #1505572
(cherry picked from commit 79414d17d84efe7434d70a4ae1436b45cfc09421)

commit_message:
[RN 7.0] Updated note about Intel X710 CNA support

This patch:

- updates the RN about support of Intel X710 CNA (according ot the
  latest discussion in Launchpad);
- removes unnecessary duplicates of the same release note.

Related-Bug: #1445562
Change-Id: I1a12cacd4ea097e20f52ada74811306e01677cd7

commit_message:
Stop checking if listener exists when uploading cert

The cert is being uplaoded in the flow BEFORE a listener is being
created. So creating a TLS load balancer will always result in an
error. This removes that check.

Closes-Bug: 1507723
Change-Id: If8d6de33ef7a4e71bdf80115da889da6f0535736

commit_message:
Add os_shutdown_timeout support

Nova allows a 'clean' shutdown to instances, the timeout value for
this comes from image metadata (image_os_shutdown_timeout) or the
compute configuration (compute.shutdown_timeout).

However there's no way to specify a custom shutdown timeout for a
particular instance.

This patch adds os_shutdown_timeout as the first priority to be used.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1446741
Change-Id: I9cef544f59a97120bc6dbe3d11c0ee1a8ec07f15

commit_message:
Disable spurious urllib warnings

Since we can return a keystoneauth1 Session correctly, disable the
stupid warnings that are evil and never should be emitted.

commit_message:
gnocchi: set the default archive policy to None

This makes sure that by default the archive policy rules created on the
Gnocchi side are used.

[{'created': '2015-10-14 12:21:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add release gates for openstack-health

This commit includes two release gates for openstack-health: one for the
api and another for the ui.

Currently, the provisioning script for this app checks out the whole
repo, fetches Python and NPM dependencies, and then starts each service.
The idea is having a tarball for each one of these, so that the
deployment process will be simplified.

commit_message:
Add release gates for openstack-health

This commit includes two release gates for openstack-health: one for the
api and another for the ui.

Currently, the provisioning script for this app checks out the whole
repo, fetches Python and NPM dependencies, and then starts each service.
The idea is having a tarball for each one of these, so that the
deployment process will be simplified.

Change-Id: Id943dbcf3a3259f9f2b6c407c4d8b1aa82fef061

commit_message:
Drop openstack.common, use oslo.db instead

The libraries we use from oslo-incubator project has been evolved into
separate libraries long time ago. Let's drop incubator, and use oslo.*
projects instead. It reduces our tech-debt, and introduce possibility
to fit upstream criteria.

Change-Id: Ib0bffc1d3e7c46f1028e06cda9bc0900acc26ee4
Closes-Bug: #1511427

commit_message:
Use default disk image size for centos/7

Latest centos/7 image from atlas now comes with 40 GB disk size which
is equal to the virtual_size we specify in the Vagrantfile.  Libvirt
provider doesn't like it and produces an ugly stacktrace.

The new default value now sufficient run kolla properly and we can
remove the code that artificially increased the disk size.

Change-Id: I7a645543cfcc027b4a3e0d02d8e7f436d8410ec5
Backport: Liberty
Closes-Bug: #1511265

commit_message:
Use assertIn

Tests should prefer:

  self.assertIn(value, list)

instead of:

  self.assertTrue(value in list)

because assertIn raises more meaningful errors:

  self.assertIn(3, [1, 2]
  >>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]

Change-Id: Ib74bbc119e4be045c60054fc49b945a8d5fb7e40

commit_message:
update unit test about quotas_client

Currently unit test about quotas_client does not support "user_id" in
test_show_default_quota_set and  test_update_quota_set.

This patch adds case of using "user_id" to these tests.

Change-Id: I6536ea1e56ee64a61f4a46c7877057fa83fc2893

Tests should use:
  self.assertIn(value, list)
  self.assertNotIn(value, list)

instead of:
  self.assertTrue(value in list)
  self.assertFalse(value in list)

because assertIn and assertNotIn raise more meaningful errors:
  self.assertIn(3, [1, 2]
  >>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]

  self.assertTrue(3 in [1, 2])
  >>> AssertionError: False is not true

commit_message:
Use assertIn and assertNotIn

Tests should use:
  self.assertIn(value, list)
  self.assertNotIn(value, list)

instead of:
  self.assertTrue(value in list)
  self.assertFalse(value in list)

because assertIn and assertNotIn raise more meaningful errors:
  self.assertIn(3, [1, 2]
  >>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]

  self.assertTrue(3 in [1, 2])
  >>> AssertionError: False is not true

Closes-Bug: #1510007
Change-Id: I19c0f05bcf5ecab7e06801ff633695779fedce06

commit_message:
Ensure closing of firefox window if setUp fails

In the functional integration test, test class opened a firefox
window as part of setUp() but in case of failure of setUp(), the
window remained open, as the tearDown() method is not called on
failure of setUp(). This problem can be solved by adding the
close command for firefox through addCleanup method which is
excecuted irrespective of success of the setUp method.

Change-Id: Ic576fa05b62afa08356f11825cbf442baaf9a4cb
Closes-bug: 1487446

commit_message:
Remove obsolete names checks

Since we don't use environments and environment templates names during
deployment process we don't need to check what is the name of the
environment. Now we should only keep it human-readable and check that
it exists.

Partial-Bug: #1405788
Change-Id: I88b447e0dbe9fde07602d4ce1e746c1ccfa62637

commit_message:
[documentation] Deletion of the articles rewritten

Deletes the following files:
1. articles/app_pkg.rst (reworked to Step by Step)
2. heat_support.rst (reworked to HOT packages)
3. troubleshooting.rst (as decided to have the only troubleshooting
section for admin and user guides)

Removed them from index.

Change-Id: I2efb841b16c2ae1c1ba3e671012d52e64c813476

commit_message:
Drop Instance v1.x support

This drops compatibility for Instance V1. Liberty supports both versions,
which means we're outside the support envelope for V1 and can remove it.
Note that this also snips out a few V1-specific compatibility bits from
what was the common base now that we don't have to support them.

UpgradeImpact: This drops support for an instance major version, which
means that you must have deployed at least commit
713d8cb0777afb9fe4f665b9a40cac894b04aacb before deploying this one.

Change-Id: I2d26399ed0d97234f240292d023769c264be2efd

commit_message:
[MongoDB] Application added

MongoDB is a cross-platform document-oriented database.
Classified as a NoSQL database, MongoDB eschews
the traditional table-based relational database structure
in favor of JSON-like documents with dynamic schemas.

Change-Id: Ica7a6e2b8e8cb903f5c34ce38386d1e179e1e9e7
Implements: blueprint add-mongodb-app

that the message extraction works with the parameter that the infra

Change-Id: I6f5c8a4dc8897b27f9f700be42d5dd38f7d278d0
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Proper translation integration

This reverts Ie518bffe825ae1c6d139a0613c30bc9748b52cd7 and
updates the scripts to properly work with the infra scripts.

It replicates now the current setup done by horizon - thus
moving the babel files to the top-level and adjusting run_tests.sh.

This copies over tools/install_venv_common.py from oslo-incubator so
that the message extraction works with the parameter that the infra
scripts expect.

The infra scripts have been adopted to work with this setup, see
change I09350bfd384f84d132dc03d9bae2a5015acb6b0f.

Change-Id: I6f5c8a4dc8897b27f9f700be42d5dd38f7d278d0

commit_message:
Add multiple floating ranges support

*Add new puppet function which formats allocation pools string for neutron
subnet resource.
*Remove ordering between neutron_network and neuton_subnet due to there
is autorequire in puppets types.
*Remove unneeded variable.

Change-Id: I040c3bc66fa0f57ed6f79d8471bd0bd239efc527
Closes-bug: #1490578

commit_message:
Implement /NetworkDriver.Leave

This patch implements /NetworkDriver.Leave, which unbinds the Neutron
port from the veth pair on the host and delete the veth pair.

Change-Id: If02f52594924811180acfaac0ec29d10c25c6869
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-25 17:19:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] Implement /NetworkDriver.Join

This patch implements /NetworkDriver.Join, which goes through the
following steps:

1. Find the Neutron port associated with the given EndpointID
2. Create the veth pair based on the info of the retrieved port
3. Bind the port to the veth endpoint
4. Construct the response with the port and return it

In the process 3, Kuryr executes the binding script specified in the
config file. Although users can specify any executable script, Kuryr
includes several default scripts by default.

Change-Id: Id3a8288199975d86812c7c1d210c7e11ae58d7b8
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-25 17:25:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] Implement /NetworkDriver.Join

following steps:

1. Find the Neutron port associated with the given EndpointID
2. Create the veth pair based on the info of the retrieved port
3. Bind the port to the veth endpoint
4. Construct the response with the port and return it

In the process 3, Kuryr executes the binding script specified in the
config file. Although users can specify any executable script, Kuryr
includes several default scripts by default.

Change-Id: Id3a8288199975d86812c7c1d210c7e11ae58d7b8
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>

This patch implements /NetworkDriver.Join, which goes through the
following steps:

1. Find the Neutron port associated with the given EndpointID
2. Create the veth pair based on the info of the retrieved port
3. Bind the port to the veth endpoint
4. Construct the response with the port and return it

In the process 3, Kuryr executes the binding script specified in the
binding:vif_type attribute of the retrieved Neutron port. Although
Neutron plugin can put arbitrary types in that attribute, if the
attribute was not specified it defaults to "unbound" and Kuryr invokes
"unbound" executable, which always fails with the status code 1.

This patch also includes the unit tests cover the successful case and
the failures.

Change-Id: Id3a8288199975d86812c7c1d210c7e11ae58d7b8
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>
', 'number': 16}]
commit_message:
Implement /NetworkDriver.Join

This patch implements /NetworkDriver.Join, which goes through the
following steps:

1. Find the Neutron port associated with the given EndpointID
2. Create the veth pair based on the info of the retrieved port
3. Bind the port to the veth endpoint
4. Construct the response with the port and return it

In the process 3, Kuryr executes the binding script specified in the
binding:vif_type attribute of the retrieved Neutron port. Although
Neutron plugin can put arbitrary types in that attribute, if the
attribute was not specified it defaults to "unbound" and Kuryr invokes
"unbound" executable, which always fails with the status code 1.

This patch also includes the unit tests cover the successful case and
the failures.

Change-Id: Id3a8288199975d86812c7c1d210c7e11ae58d7b8
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>

The cells job is failing to boot from volume with a bdm v2 request like:

"block_device_mapping_v2": [{
    "destination_type": "volume",

    "uuid": "553083ac-40f2-4225-ac4d-a1d021eb7fb1",

of the devref to add as code comments for the validation happening so we
have context.

omits the last element of the list that it's processing, we need to doc
that logic in the code for maintainability.

commit_message:
Add debug logging for when boot sequence is invalid in _validate_bdm

The cells job is failing to boot from volume with a bdm v2 request like:

"block_device_mapping_v2": [{
    "destination_type": "volume",
    "boot_index": 0,
    "uuid": "553083ac-40f2-4225-ac4d-a1d021eb7fb1",
    "source_type": "volume",
    "delete_on_termination": true
}]

Given it seems there should only be one BDM in the list and it's boot
index is 0, we shouldn't fail on the boot sequence validation, so add
some debug logging when we hit that failure.

Also copy some wording out of the 'Block Device Mapping in Nova' section
of the devref to add as code comments for the validation happening so we
have context.

TODO(mriedem): track down ndipanov to figure out why _subsequent_list
omits the last element of the list that it's processing, we need to doc
that logic in the code for maintainability.

Change-Id: I8adc94f3c93c149689fbef424665fb44ac573819
Related-Bug: #1489581

commit_message:
Added natural sort for interfaces in utils.ordered_active_nics()

This way device eth10 is after eth9, and not directly after eth1

Change-Id: I81eba97cccf6c4f314f9037d16ee1f244dbade02
Closes-Bug: #1482818

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-11-02 12:08:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovsvapp/mech_driver.py'], 'message': "Added postcommit hooks in ovsvapp mech_driver

This patch-set added the postcommit methods for network and port
in ovsvapp mechanism driver which is required by ovsvapp driver.py
sitting in openstack/networking-vsphere repo.

This issue was addressed in 'master' (Mitaka) as part of review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240127/

commit_message:
Added postcommit hooks in ovsvapp mech_driver

This patch-set added the postcommit methods for network and port
in ovsvapp mechanism driver which is required by ovsvapp driver.py
sitting in openstack/networking-vsphere repo.

This issue was addressed in 'master' (Mitaka) as part of review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240127/

Backporting the relevant part of that fix here, since 
cherrypicking is not possible.

Closes-Bug: #1512328

Change-Id: I066891d83f005c7214a2496812ca506003d32c5f

commit_message:
Remove dashes from short tar params

Using dashes with tar's short parameters creates a bunch of extra logging
output and warnings.  This should greatly reduce logging output.

Change-Id: Icf9392c749e3f9731e5bc182a242a2bc11e440a9

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-10 16:18:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "DRAC BIOS vendor_passthru: enable rebooting the node

Changing the BIOS settings require rebooting the node. If the node was
originally powered off, the driver would need to turn it on, poll the
job status on the DRAC card and power off the node. To keep things
simple, the BIOS mgmt vendor_passthru methods avoided doing that.

However, it would be beneficial for the user to let them decide whether
they want to reboot the node automatically after the config job
succeeds. DRAC cards already support this, so the driver doesn't need to
supervise the config job status.

Change-Id: Id9a87f6dec6a8d6160948e39a763134729cead99

commit_message:
DRAC BIOS vendor_passthru: enable rebooting the node

Changing the BIOS settings require rebooting the node. If the node was
originally powered off, the driver would need to turn it on, poll the
job status on the DRAC card and power off the node. To keep things
simple, the BIOS mgmt vendor_passthru methods avoided doing that.

However, it would be beneficial for the user to let them decide whether
they want to reboot the node automatically after the config job
succeeds. DRAC cards already support this, so the driver doesn't need to
supervise the config job status. With this patch the DRAC vendor
passthru for commit_bios_config accepts a 'reboot' parameter.

Closes-bug: #1508459
Change-Id: Id9a87f6dec6a8d6160948e39a763134729cead99

enable/disable the name unique of Senlin objects that belong
to the same project.

commit_message:
Fix the neutron-lbaas agent config

This patch should fix the functional gate. The issue is that devstack
switch to stevedore aliases for interface_driver configuration [1],
but lbaas doesn't use aliases. This patch fixed the broken config.
This patch should be considered as a temporary workaround. We need
to investigate why devstack doesn't populate the correct config at
the first place.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/237519/

Closes-Bug: #1512933
Change-Id: I73b9e146ad4cc253e6a04bcadc07f124a7c96df5

commit_message:
Raise exception when adding an existed attribute while update bay

This patch raises a reasonable ClientSideError exception when adding
an existed attribute while doing update bay.

Besides, several apply_jsonpatch unit test cased added.
Remove all related add_(existed) attr case of api side.

Closes-Bug: #1509656
Change-Id: Ifb0c8c7ca6cfe44481a436b9a8bbdb9143bb6d94
