revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-05 22:09:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use 'https' protocol by default as easier for proxies

The 'https' protocol is easily handled by proxy servers.  The 'git'
proxy, not so much.

Change the default protocol to be 'https' for git repositories.

Change-Id: Ib59c5b5cc986dacea2c31a787c89040e7534010e
Signed-off-by: John L. Villalovos <john.l.villalovos@intel.com>
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-02-06 16:09:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use 'https' protocol by default as easier for proxies

The 'https' protocol is easily handled by proxy servers.  The 'git'
proxy, not so much.

Change the default protocol to be 'https' for git repositories.

Change-Id: Ib59c5b5cc986dacea2c31a787c89040e7534010e
Signed-off-by: John L. Villalovos <john.l.villalovos@intel.com>
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-02-09 16:04:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use 'https' protocol by default as easier for proxies

The 'https' protocol is easily handled by proxy servers.  The 'git'
proxy, not so much.

Change the default protocol to be 'https' for git repositories.

Using 'git://' as the protocol requires more extensive configuration of
proxy servers and in particular requires usage of a SOCKS proxy.  While
'https://' is easily handled by setting the environment variable
'https_proxy'.

In limited testing the time to 'git clone' the Nova project was
comparable for both 'https://' and 'git://'

This is reverting part of the change introduced by
commit 047cac56e14552eb6b2d374a35f3a092c5f2a5d4 which changed the
URL from https://github.com/ to git://git.openstack.org/ on 7-Nov-2013.

Prior to that change 'https://' was used as the default protocol going
back to 25-Oct-2011 (commit c2b3cf7ff87cd93113a36eb9756705b905a7f6dc)

'https://' as a protocol for Git is widely used by sites like
https://github.com/ and https://android-review.googlesource.com/
https://android-review.googlesource.com/ does not support 'git://'

Change-Id: Ib59c5b5cc986dacea2c31a787c89040e7534010e
Signed-off-by: John L. Villalovos <john.l.villalovos@intel.com>

commit_message:
Use 'https' protocol if 'https_proxy' environment var is set

If the user has set the 'https_proxy' environment variable then assume
they are behind a proxy server.  In that case use 'https://' as the git
protocol.  Otherwise keep using the 'git://' protocol.  The user can
still override the value by setting the variable GIT_BASE

The 'https://' protocol is easily handled by proxy servers.  The
'git://' protocol requires a rather complex configuration to use through
a proxy server.

Using 'git://' as the protocol requires more extensive configuration of
proxy servers and in particular requires usage of a SOCKS proxy.  While
'https://' is easily handled by setting the environment variable
'https_proxy'.

Change-Id: Ib59c5b5cc986dacea2c31a787c89040e7534010e
Signed-off-by: John L. Villalovos <john.l.villalovos@intel.com>

commit_message:

There are a few words that I have noticed throughout Keystone
that should be capitalized when they were not.  The few words
I fix are: Fernet, SQLite and MySQL.

commit_message:
Improve tox.ini to easy developer's life

This patch is mainly porting from nova repository:

Adds:
1.tools/flake8wrap.sh
  Will let developer use 'tox -epep8 -- -HEAD' to testing changes files
2.tools/pretty_tox.sh
  Give pretty test trace when doing unit/functional testing.

Change-Id: Icedb4ed8b50532531e18784a1584fe63c5a9e017

Networking Guide - Provider Network image misleading

"provider network" is identified between the neutron router and
the physical infrastructure.

commit_message:
Add useful links to project README.rst

Add more information in README.rst

Include
* showing the latest package version and download count on top
* list source links relative to manila like PyPi, Launchpad project,
Blueprints, Bugs, Source, and How to Contribute.

Change-Id: Ic8cbc6ff6c5389095c14d3ae65bfefa3e8f1fd5d

commit_message:
Add http400 for reference to nonexistent resource

We tend to use "404 NotFound" for all nonexistent resource cases
due to the name, but the RFC says its usage and we need to use 400
for some cases. This patch adds these cases for avoiding confusions.

Change-Id: Ie6e461a133a62de1c87b4b6d963c02fa91aca63c
